story:
I recently graduated from Bennington College in the US. I study social sciences, and music, with an emphasis on public action and conflict resolution. The question of how arts, specifically documentary songwriting and music, can create social change in societies and help in conflict transformation processes, community building/development and creating solutions for social problems has become central to my education at Bennington College.

When I visited Cyprus for a short period of time last summer, I found “Home for Cooperation” organization. I immediately communicated with people in charge and told my peace project ideas. Last winter, I did my internship at Home for Cooperation and initiated my project which is called "Songs Across Boundaries."

The goal of the project is to collect stories from both Turkish Cypriots and Greek Cypriots about the friendship, neighborhood, marriage relationships and solidarity between these two communities before and after the separation of the island, create lyrics from these stories and then compose these songs. I have made 10 compositions from the stories I collected during my internship. We will give concerts, consisting of these songs, on 5th of September in Ataturk Kultur Merkezi in Nicosia and on 6th of September in Home for Cooperation at the buffer zone in Nicosia. If we can find enough support, we desire to record these songs in the recording studio.

In order to complete the project successfully, we need $ 2.500  for the recording studio, preparing CDs, concert expenses and promotion of the project.

The project aims to show the ways that music and arts can contribute peacebuilding efforts and create deeper awareness of major problems in the island life. Alienation is a basic aspect of a culture of violence, which derives from the preservation of social structures in Cyprus and elsewhere that maintain perceptions and attitudes against basic human values, such as the acceptance of diversity, intercultural respect, reconciliation and solidarity. The project's imperative is to recognize the problem and to plan innovative actions, in order to construct bridges across the existing divides and barriers (physical, psychological, mental etc.). Stories always play an important role in conveying people’s emotions and thoughts and that’s why it is our responsibility to find these stories about people’s common past, and their island life and convey them in a most effective way. Music, as one of the more powerful tools in conveying emotions and experiences, will make these stories more meaningful where people can access the original songs anytime, realize there are so many different types of stories about these communities’ relationship with each other and learn how to respect the other culture. The project has two main purposes: One is to show the importance of collaboration and to bring people from Turkish Cypriot community and Greek Cypriot community together in a safe and welcoming environment where they can spend some time with each other, can learn each other’s songs and lyrics and create deeper bonds. The second aim is to reach out to more people in other countries through songs in order to create deeper awareness about the sensitive issues of Cyprus. It is envisioned that this project will assist in construction of new meanings and will become symbolic in the sense that it will suggest a paradigm shift in the society.

The documentary song I shared above "Suli and I" is told by a Greek Cypriot woman which is about a childhood friendship with a Turkish Cypriot family (you can find the lyrics below the video).

If you can share this project on social media platforms and support me, you will help this project to come true and  contribute to to the achievement of the project.

story:
Living your truth is hard work.

Finding a great doctor doesn’t have to be.

We are a team of trans and queer young leaders born & raised in Arizona. In partnership with the Obama Foundation, we’re creating a directory website to connect trans, gender nonconforming, and nonbinary (T/GNC/NB) people in AZ with medical/mental/behavioral healthcare providers who have experience treating people under the trans umbrella.

ARIZONA, WE HAVE A PROBLEM:

Trans people have overwhelmingly negative experiences when interacting with healthcare providers in AZ. Not only are we a community that experiences increased health risks, we're also a community that has a harder time accessing competent and respectful care. The nationwide statistics are terrifying…

And all of these experiences are negatively compounded by racial/class discrimination.*

If you're as disheartened about this reality as we are, give what you can today so that we can connect trans Arizonans to healthcare providers who are already getting it right.

A RESOURCE FOR AND BY THE COMMUNITY

This project was informed at every stage by feedback from T/GNC/NB folks and LGBTQ-friendly healthcare providers. We built every feature with their needs in mind to ensure that the search for a great provider will be safe, intuitive, and hassle-free. We're running on a tight budget, but we aren't cutting any corners on quality. Here are some of the site's features:

SO WHY DO WE NEED $4,000?

Building a directory website from scratch is stupid-expensive, so we purchased a membership with a company that builds, hosts, & supports online directories. But in order for our site to meet all of the specific needs our community asked for, we need to have a few custom features built from scratch. Like we said, we're not skimping on quality.

Here's the breakdown:

We need just 200 supporters to give $20 each in order to reach our fundraising goal! Give $20 & share with anyone who might support us! We are trying to build a community of care, and we understand that sometimes many small contributions can be even more valuable than a few large ones. Thanks for you support! 

- The QuTopia Team

 

* Statistics from Human Rights Campaign's Healthcare Equality Index (2018) & The National Center for Transgender Equality's US Trans Survey (2017)

story:
Our Goal

Hi and thanks for visiting. The goal of this campaign is to collect and/or purchase backpacks and supplies to fill them in order to give them out as outreach tools and to help people experiencing homelessness, with a focus on veterans. This campaign ends on Nov. 11th - Veterans day and then we will purchase items and fill the backpacks to have ready for the first week of December.

  • My name is Steve Conrad and I have worked in the non-profit field for 18 years - first with abused children ages 11-17 in a residential care facility and most recently at the Human Services Campus - a campus of over 15 agencies dedicated to ending homelessness.
  • This campaign is aimed and helping end homelessness for veterans because I believe no person who risked their life to defend this country and the people in it should be left to fend for themselves on the streets.
  • This backpack drive may seem like just a small action but by supplying an outreach team with backpacks filled with blankets, toiletries, water, and other survival items, they can build a rapport with those experiencing homelessness and can engage and hopefully get a person off the streets and into services to help them end their homelessness.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is $1,000.00 in funding which can supply 100 filled backpacks.
  • I know many campaigns have shirts and mugs and other perks but we would like 100% of the funds raised to go to homeless veterans and others experiencing homelessness. We will write you with our sincere thanks and keep you updated on our progress through photos and videos.
  • We are hoping to get lots of items donated, as well, so every dollar will just help us provide more backpacks and essential survival items. If we go over our goal, we will just get that many more backpacks and items.
  • If you are like me you might be conflicted when you see someone standing on a corner begging for money. You may want to give but not know if you would truly be helping the person. This is a way to know that you are doing something to help and not just a temporary fix but a real possibility and helping end that persons homelessness.

Let's help end homelessness for Veterans

  • Every dollar given will help someone experiencing homelessness and help them get essential services, too, by giving outreach members a way to engage with someone experiencing homelessness.
  • The organization we work with each each is Madison Street Veterans Association, a nationally recognized program that won the "Champion of change award" from the President in 2011.
  • While "ending homelessness" is a lofty and seemingly unobtainable goal, it is possible to end homelessness one person at a time and that is the focus of this campaign. Engage someone living on the streets, offer them services such as job searches, new clothes, showers, and shelter. We would like to help get people back on their feet until they can stand for themselves. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute money at this time we need help with the following:

  • Getting backpacks, toiletries (shampoo, soap, toothbrushes, toothpaste, combs, etc.), and water bottles (refillable) donated.
  • Helping to stuff the backpacks with all of the items in assembly line fashion.
  • Helping to get the word out by sharing this campaign with others

Thank you!!

story:
Latest LGBT+, the UK’s first terrestrial LGBT TV channel

Beginning in February 2017 we’ll be bringing the best in LGBT news and entertainment to our viewers TV screens.

Initially broadcasting for an hour a day on Freeview and Virgin Media in the Sussex area as well as globally online our aim is to continue to grow our coverage and raise awareness of LGBT issues as well as entertaining our viewers.

The world is changing, and not always for the better, throughout the world there is an ever increasing wave of bigotry and prejudice,  barely a week goes by without some kind of misleading, negative story.

As a respected local television broadcaster, Latest TV are the best TV channel to deliver on this project with two National Diversity Award nominations between channel head Sophie Cook and our CEO Bill Smith.

And with the talented team including Sophie Cook and creative director Andrew Kay, we have the credibility and talent to create a channel to be proud of, and with your help, we will.

Continuing the journey that began two years ago with the creation of Brighton’s TV channel, Latest TV, and diversified with the appointment of Sophie to the news team in June 2016, becoming Europe’s first transgender newscaster, we are now ready to bring you Latest LGBT+.

In the same way that BBC channels might switch over to BBC News 24 at certain times of the day so Latest TV will hand control of Freeview channel 7 and Virgin Media 159 over to Latest LGBT+ for our own brand of inclusive broadcasting, spreading the message of equality and diversity directly into people’s homes.

We’re different to a lot of the LGBT coverage that you’ll see on other broadcasters, being members of the community our programming will never be voyeuristic, exploitative or sensationalist.

Our core concepts are ones that inform all of our content decisions in that everything we show should entertain, educate or inspire our viewers, and if it does all three at the same time that’s even better.

And being a small organisation we listen to you, our viewers, giving us the advantage of being community led and allowing us the opportunity to give a voice to those that are often denied one.

So how can we do this?

We’ve already been broadcasting as Latest TV to the greater Brighton region for two years bringing our viewers a great mix of news, films, sports and entertainment.

We create great, high quality, programming with a number of our shows having been bought and distributed globally including to the BBC and Amazon Prime.

And we provide a platform for LGBT filmmakers to share their work, giving them access to an audience that was, until now, unavailable to them.

People power can change the world from the ground up and help to combat prejudice and injustice wherever it may appear.

We can inform policy rather than simply report on it.

But, I hear you ask, why would a TV company need to raise funds, surely they’re all massive corporations dripping in cash?

Until now that could have been true for TV broadcasters in the UK, with the commercial stations being supported by major advertising revenues and the BBC receiving government funding in the form of the TV license fee.

We receive NO ongoing government funding at all.

We’re different, we’re more like the American model of PBS television in that our funding comes from a variety of sources including advertising, corporate sponsorships, grants and you, our viewers.

This is where you come in. We are looking for enlightened pioneers to help us get this off the ground.

We’re asking if you would join us in being part of one of the most exciting developments in British television for decades by supporting our work with a donation.

With this campaign if you give: 

  • £25 - a shout out on social media
  • £100 - Sophie Cook will personally record a thank you message and post it on yours and our social media
  • £500 - a limited edition signed 8x12’’ print of one of Sophie Cook’s iconic photographic images - www.sophiecookphotography.co.uk
  • £1000 - a 30 second advertisement or shout out made by us or you to be aired no less than 5 times
  • £5000 - A meal for 2 with your very own host Sophie Cook or Andrew Kay in either London or Brighton or a speech at the event of your choice by Sophie Cook (T&C's apply)

All of these come, of course, with our unending love and gratitude.

Together we can be the change that we want to see in the world. 

Pride not prejudice.

Thank you

story:
We're planning a full slate of Spring/Summer kickabouts -- but it will only happen with your support!


LGBT community soccer is a Seattle tradition

Since at least 2002, the Seattle LGBT soccer community has enjoyed a free and open pickup game on a reserved field most Sundays of the year.  These days it's called Sunday Kickabout .

Free to play, but not free

Sunday Kickabout is free to play for all.  Financial means are not a barrier to entry for our players, and we don't collect fees on the field.  However, Kickabout does cost money.

Unlike many other pickup games in Seattle, our pickup games take place on reserved, high quality turf fields, mostly on Capitol Hill.  We think that providing an event in a safe, guaranteed venue helps avoid scheduling chaos and provides participants with a quality, fun experience.  That said, reserving fields with the City of Seattle is not inexpensive.  The several thousand dollars of field fees paid by kickabout each year constitute our only expense -- and one that is paid for by those who attend.

Why it matters

It's likely that several thousand players have visited and enjoyed Kickabout over the years.  Probably several hundred have found their way from our pickup games to play on other teams for our parent club, Rain City Soccer.  Most importantly though, Seattle Kickabout is the only explicitly LGBT-positive open soccer game in the city -- and we want to keep it going.

How you can help

Two ways:  

1.  If you're able, please give!  Money collected through this campaign will go straight to paying our only expense for spring and summer -- field costs.

2.  If you can't give, come out to Kickabout anyway!  It's super-fun and we'd love to see you there.

story:
One in 30 children experienced homelessness in America last year. This experience on children is profound. The stress and trauma in their lives affects their development and ability to learn. They lose their sense of joy and their ability to play. Please help us make their dark clouds disappear for one, very special day.


Birthday parties have a huge impact on young children and homeless children are at risk for not enjoying this quintessential childhood experience. With your help, these children will experience a fantastic birthday party in a unique and playful space, with all the love and attention centered on them. Isn't this something that every child should have growing up? Together, let's make some birthday dreams come true in 2015.


Your donation to our birthday party campaign today will fund dozens of birthday parties for homeless children participating in Habitot's homeless family program in 2015.  Last year, Habitot was able to offer birthday love to 200 people experiencing homelessness last year.  Each party will include:

  • 2.5 hours of exclusive time in the Museum for the birthday child and up to 75 family members and friends
  • A dedicated party room
  • Personalized birthday cake
  • A special present for the birthday child
  • Decorations and music
  • Goodie-bags for the guests
  • Supplies for the art-room
  • Staff to guide activities
  • Transportation to the Museum, if needed

At-Home-At-Habitot is Habitot's outreach and inclusion program for homeless families. In 2014, we partnered with four local homeless shelters or transitional housing sites and served 40 families. We have a seven-year track record of helping this vulnerable community back into the mainstream of families raising young children, providing a fun, safe and nurturing place to play, to re-establish bonds and to experience joy together. On each visit, families receive food, books, clothing, toys (all donated by other agencies) and a huge amount of love.

Habitot Children's Museum is a non-profit organization which provides a full program of interactive exhibits, classes and camps, and multicultural events and performances geared to  0-7 year olds. We know that the earliest years are crucial to emotional, physical, social and intellectual development so that children reach their potential. Habitot plays a critical role as a 'learning lab' for new parents as well, providing information, resources, workshops, and support for the toughest job around. 

In addition to reaching out to and including homeless families, Habitot offers dedicated enrichment programs for the following groups: immigrant caregivers, teen parents, children with special needs, foster families, formerly incarcerated parents, LBGTQ families and low income families. Habitot is also a leader in recognizing the Bay Area's early childhood educators by presenting its annual "Preschool Teachers Make A Difference" awards, now in its 7th year.


There are lots of ways to get involved - give as much as you can to Birthday Parties for Homeless Children, and forward this campaign to your friends and family members. Help spread the word through your social networks. If your employer matches your charitable donations, you could double or triple the impact of your gift. Perks given as thank you's  for your support can be passed along as gifts to others this holiday season.


We can brighten the lives of children living in homelessness. Please dig as deep as you can and let's make many little dreams come true.

The Habitot team extends their sincere gratitude and thanks to Robyn Dettman, Courtesy of Duendefilms West, for her amazing work on the campaign video.

We have a seven-year track record of helping this vulnerable community back into the mainstream of families raising young children, providing a fun, safe and nurturing place to play, to re-establish bonds and to experience joy together. On each visit, families receive food, books, clothing, toys (all donated by other agencies) and a huge amount of love.



Habitot Children's Museum is a non-profit organization which provides a full program of interactive exhibits, classes and camps, and multicultural events and performances geared to  0-7 year olds. We know that the earliest years are crucial to emotional, physical, social and intellectual development so that children reach their potential. Habitot plays a critical role as a 'learning lab' for new parents as well, providing information, resources, workshops, and support for the toughest job around. 

In addition to reaching out to and including homeless families, Habitot offers dedicated enrichment programs for the following groups: immigrant caregivers, teen parents, children with special needs, foster families, formerly incarcerated parents, LBGTQ families and low income families. Habitot is also a leader in recognizing the Bay Area's early childhood educators by presenting its annual "Preschool Teachers Make A Difference" awards, now in its 7th year.

There are lots of ways to get involved - give as much as you can to Birthday Parties for Homeless Children, and forward this campaign to your friends and family members. Help spread the word through your social networks. If your employer matches your charitable donations, you could double or triple the impact of your gift. Perks given as thank you's  for your support can be passed along as gifts to others this holiday season.


We can brighten the lives of children living in homelessness. Please dig as deep as you can and let's make many little dreams come true.
The Habitot team extends their sincere gratitude and thanks to Robyn Dettman, Courtesy of Duendefilms West, for her amazing work on the campaign video.

story:
We are the Mayday Club Youth Choir for Autism Advocacy, the world's very first autism advocacy children's performance crew. Everybody in our crew is between the ages of 5 and 30, and either has a diagnosed developmental condition, loves somebody who does, or would like to gain experience working and socializing with individuals with neuro-diversities. With the love and support of our community, we are releasing our first album, 'Screaming Rainbows'. The album is intended to spread the happy, innocent voices of young people affected by autism and other neuro-diversities, as they join together in celebrating youth, life, friendship, and the power of music. It is our goal to spread our music far and wide, until everyone has heard our message of acceptance, hope, and love for everyone.

Listen to a sample here:  https://maydayclubyouthchoir.bandcamp.com/track...

Please visit us online at www.facebook.com/maydayclubyouthchoir and at www.maydayclub.ca

This album is made possible by executive producer Sergio Cocchia and sound mixer Andy Warren of Crew Studios (http://www.crew-studios.com/studio/). It is also made possible by our community partners including Crew Studios, Monarch House Fraser Valley, Chewie Media Inc., New World Technologies, and Pivot Point Family Growth Centre, and by some amazing individuals including Sylvia Dirks, Virginia Renaud, Dan Renaud, Tara Macrae, Angela Betts, Lisa Crabb, Lynda Sharpe, Jenna Provost, Tia Oostenbrug, and Tracey Barnett.

All proceeds from album and merchandise sales will go to supporting the choir to continue to be a safe-space for those who are different, and so that the Mayday Club can expand their programs and services to reach more youth who may be struggling to find friends.

story:
In the past two months, more than 480,000 (as of 09/26/2017,ISCG) Rohingya refugees have been forcefully driven out from Burma to the refugee camps in Bangladesh. Known to have the highest risk of facing genocide in the world, Rohingya have abandoned their homes and possessions, walking for weeks through mountains and rivers to escape violence, rape, and death.

Many have arrived at refugee camps, and are still suffering from starvation, harsh weather conditions, and severe infections. The stories and reports we encountered are beyond shocking and heartbreaking. As more refugees are arriving at the camps over the weeks, it has become increasingly difficult for NGOs to support their survival as there are limited quantities of emergency shelters, medical and food kits. 

Good Neighbors is an international humanitarian development NGO founded in Korea in 1991. We are supporting Rohingya refugees with $80,000-worth emergency relief program in refugee camps in Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh. Korean donors are supporting us as well as our international neighbours all around the world. Good Neighbors Bangladesh staffs and volunteers are monitoring the refugee camps to analyse the current situation and distribute food kit (rice, salt, oil, etc.) and emergency relief kits consiting other basic needs. 

Good Neighbors Bangladesh has partnered up with other local NGOs and UN agents to provide direct support to refugee camps. Not only the refugees are suffering from a lack of food and water source, but due to an ever increasing number of refugees, their basic human rights are being threatened even now. Child abuse and sexual harrasment are rampant. We hope our international community would give them more attention and support. Join us with Good Neighbors Canada's good change to make the world a place without hunger, where people live together in harmony!

story:
BREAKING !!! We are going to HORGOS (Serbian border) because Hungary closed the border, so at this moment refugees are stranded in Serbia under very bad conditions !!! Roszke (Hungarian border) is now empty. The Hungarian government deployed flanks of police and soldiers wielding automatic weapons to patrol its border with Serbia, assisted by a 110-mile long newly constructed barbed-wire fence !!! :(

Short Summary

We are husband (Jürgen) and wife (Olga) who are traveling to Horgos (Serbian-Hungarian border) from Vienna on 14th of October. In Horgos, thousands of refugees are right now located. They are right now living under extremely bad conditions.

Approximately 2000 refugees are stranded near Horgos collection point, who are facing the night without any supplies. Half of the crowd are women and children, and the number of people are growing.

It is 6 celsius and cooling, and there are thousands of people under open sky. By morning they may get simply frozen, that even the policemen are in a very bad shape!

The people are tired, exhausted, the children are crying. They are cold!!!

What We Need & What You Get

We will buy warm blankets ,sleeping bags, raincoats, easy to use tents (from Decathlon).

Blanket: 8 $ (goal: 20 items)

Raincoat: 15 $ (goal: 10 items)

Sleeping bags: 22 $ (goal: 10 items)

Tent: 25 $ (goal: 5 items)

Everything is needed that can help in 6 degrees outside in the middle of nowhere.We are going to cover percentage IndieGoGo takes, that way, 100% of your money goes to the refugees. We will also try to contact other organisations, to cooperate with.

We have already 625 $! Great! Thank you. Love you guys!

Risks:

There is literally no risk. We are going to turn your money into supplies. We are going to take a picture of your donation. Excess Money will be donated!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to send money, feel free to share.

Whoever could ship any of the above mentioned items directly to Horgos is cordially requested to do ASAP.

Thank You For Your Help!Sometimes Those Who Have Less, Are The Ones Who Give More.

Articles: 

http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/europes-border-crisis/migrants-rush-border-hungary-shuts-crossings-n427091

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/...

story:
Who, what & why?

We are a group of artists, social and youth workers with diverse artistic, social and management experience. What unites us is the belief that we can make a difference.

Timișoara Refugee Art Festival started in 2017 as a mix of diverse forms of artistic expression, with the purpose of bringing into discussion forced migration at a national and international level, as well as bringing the host community closer to the refugee community. TRAF 2018 builds on the first edition, focusing on the theme of ”Subjectification”, a theme looking to encourage positive models in order to react towards objectification through understanding, empathy and trust.

Our goal is to create the framework for a constructive dialogue between people, to participate in the creation of solid, responsible and conscious communities, to provide members of these communities with the confidence to engage actively in community life and with a safe space to make their voice heard. 

With your contribution, we can stay independent and true to our values. TRAF 2018 will consist of film and music videos screenings, concerts, exhibitions and theatre shows of local and international artists, together with educational activities for children and teenagers and an academic conference.

Why we need you?

The $ 10.000 budget we are asking you for will cover just about half of the total costs of the festival. Besides this, we already secured funding from various donors and sponsors for an arts camp with 20 young refugees and non refugees, local and national artists performances, the academic and educational section, an international short film selection, location rental and other production costs. So here is how we will spend the money we're asking you for: 

$2.000 for theatre, storytelling and visual arts workshops with a group of young refugees and non refugees together.

$3.000 for inviting one or two refugee arts groups from abroad (a theatre group from Berlin and some musicians from EU or Turkey).

$2.000 for production costs - sound, lights and props.

$1.000 for promoting the festival (design, prints and online)

$1.000 for management costs

$1.000 for campaign fees and perks

We are determined to make this festival happen no matter the costs, that's why we set up a flexible goal campaign. Depending on how much we manage to raise with your support, there will be more events and artists involved in this project. By the way, check out our special perks and make sure you get yours before they run out! 

Impact

In 2017, TRAF gathered more than 300 people together as a statement for tolerance, trust, respect and solidarity. Have a glimpse of last year's edition here: 

 

Through your contribution, not only you can help us make this happen, but you also become part of a community that shares these values. The more of us come together, the stronger and more visible we get!

Although TRAF takes place in Timisoara, Romania and it addresses directly only the local community, the previous edition had a high visibility at a national level in Romania and was recommended as a good practice model by the Creative Europe program and by several other partner organizations in Hungary, Bulgaria, Italy, France, Spain, Germany, Cyprus and Belgium.

With your contribution we can make this project relevant to the international community and raise awareness on its importance worldwide. We are open to partner with groups and organizations from all over the world in order to create a global movement that understands and supports the moving nature of human beings. In the end, we are the most dynamic species on planet earth, as humans inhabit every corner of the globe.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk of this project is that people like you don't get involved. Of course we need money to make it happen but more than that we need you to support our cause. In several years of community based projects we have learned that money is just a tool but the real value is in the people that come together. This is why we need you!

Other main risks are the short time frame from securing the funding to the actual event, aggressive reactions from extremist groups and bad weather. While we don't have any control on the last two, we are used with the magic of making things happen so we assure you we will make the best use of the money you invest.

The enthusiasm and experience we gathered over the years make us see obstacles as challenges and we are always happy to creatively overcome them and learn from it. Honestly, no obstacle can stop us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you resonate in any way with our project, it is the most valuable thing for us. While we need money to make it happen, we value most your trust and determination to contribute. So, whether or not you can support us financially, please spread the word and make some noise about TRAF! Please use the indiegogo specific tools to maximize the impact of sharing this cause!

Thank you and looking forward to seeing you at TRAF, either in person or just in spirit!

story:
#TogetherStrong began during San Diego PRIDE 2017.

As the movement generated momentum, it became something larger than ourselves. It became something beautiful. 

It is our goal to include all who wish to be a part of this powerful project. 


We are creating "In-Home Portrait Kits" to enable people, regardless of location, to participate and share their stories. A magical and cathartic process occurs during the painting process and we want everyone to share in that feeling. 


When you back our Indiegogo campaign, you enable us to build our inventory of "In-Home Portrait Kits" and to reach larger segments of the population. To that end, we have several perk options available, including additional colors and representation.

And the best part, for every "In-Home Portrait Kit" sold, we will be donating $10 to LGBT nonprofits. By donating a portion of our proceeds to the organizations working hard in our communities, we not only spread awareness, we also make a tangible difference in people’s lives.

 

Each portrait kit contains enough paint for two people. Whether you are joining this movement with a group of friends, your family, or even just yourself, we want you to share your story. We have included a "Story Questionnaire" in each portrait kit with directions for uploading, allowing you to share as much or as little as you like about your journey.


Thank you for being part of this powerful movement. We are very excited for you to share your story.

 

We are, #TogetherStrong.

story:
We are a small team of entrepreneurs with a strong background in engineering and successful integration of computer vision systems in different industries. The idea of the project was born as a response to our close friend's possible loss of vision because of eye injuries. Luckily, our friend regained the sight and now we hope to develop the idea, materialized in our prototypes into a mature product and make it available for all the people impaired vision. 
At the moment we require funding for further research and product development, especially product design and optimizations for mass production. You may support our project by ordering our perks including hand crafted device prototypes as well as different souvenirs - the price of each perk includes some part which will be spent on R&D activities. 
If you decide to be an "early bird" user of the device, you will get the very first device ahead of mass-production schedule; we will also be happy to consider (and hopefully implement) your ideas to bring the best usage experience for you!
Got a friend or relative with impaired vision? Want to help blind people - go ahead and support our project! Become our backer and get one of our wonderful perks and bring more happiness to blind people's lives!

story:
Resistance Con 2017

June 3rd, 2017 Durham Convention Center, NC

I'm Holly McKinney, and I was one of the millions of people who participated in the Women's March on January 21st to speak out against inequality and division. The sense of love, unity, and urgency there inspired me to want to do something in my community to bring people together to celebrate diversity and learn how to challenge injustices.

My husband is one of the directors of the NC Comicon, and I asked him to help me in creating a special convention. An event that would utilize the resources in our state to provide guidance and solidarity. A way to direct people's energy and desire to help those who are most marginalized in the current political climate.  A place to take pride in your identity. A fundraising event for nonprofit organizations.

The feedback we've gotten so far has been incredible. I know that this convention can and will be positive, inspirational, educational, and a ton of fun. We already have amazing artists, musicians, activists, writers, and nonprofits who have agreed to participate in panels, run workshops, put on interactive art installations, and perform their music (check out what we have so far! http://resistancecon.com). 

Putting on an event of this scale costs money. My husband and I have used our savings to put down the deposits for the event spaces, everything has been reserved, and now we need your help.  The convention center and music venues rentals, providing tables and PA systems, hiring security, advertising, providing travel and lodging for out of town guests, filing with the government as a nonprofit corporation (update: we are now officially a 501(c)(3) nonprofit corporation) -- it all adds up quickly.

You can ensure that this event lives up to its potential. I know that there are countless people out there who, like me, are looking for a way to make positive change in these troubling times. Resistance Con will be a place where attendees can explore the area's many incredible organizations and the work that they do and find a cause to personally advocate for. Each one of us can make a difference.

We've got tickets, t-shirts, and so much more. Please see if there's a tier that's right for you. And if you would just like to donate, the "back it" button enables you to contribute any amount that you're comfortable with.

Let's make this happen! And if you're not able to donate, please spread the word. Make some noise.

Join the Resistance.

story:
Support refugees build a better future 

Help us break the narrative that underpin conflicts and the cycle of violence by challenging the underlying rationale through film. Let's empower the refugees by giving them a voice through their own films and documentaries; produced by them, for them and shared with us all.

 

The Challenge

[Armed] conflicts are too often pushed by narratives that provide a rationale to commit atrocities that people otherwise would reject. When displaced people are forced to coexist with nothing to do it often strengthens, or reinforce, the narratives that led to the conflict in the first place. Conflicts escalate and explode, or they are carried with the refugees back home once they return, providing fertile soil for renewed conflicts and future exodus. It becomes a cycle of violence that never seems to end. The question is - what can we do to help stop this cycle.

 

Break the Cycle by Challenging the Narrative that lead to Violence 

Challenge the narratives, or the rationale, and we might have a chance to break the cycle of violence. We want to kick-start a thought process using films and documentaries to question the use of violence as a means to and end. Film is storytelling. Film is emotional. Film is universal. Films will not stop the civil war in Syria but might start a process which will make it easier to rebuild the country once the fighting stop. Deescalating existing conflicts also have an immediate benefit in reducing tensions and violence in the camps and preventing refugees from becoming radicalized. 

 

We need to Activate the Refugees and give them Hope

They say idelenss is the root to all evil. Being in a refugee camp for years on end with nothing to do makes it easy to fall prey to negativity and hate. That's why we need your help to build an activity center for the refugees in the Al-Talabia refugee camp outside of Amman, Jordan. We plan to install a cinema unit and do film workshops together with a local community organization. The center will also be available to the refugees for other activities and trainings. 

1. Build a community center 2. Screen movies 3. Film workshop

The methodology for the film workshop is based on using tools and equipment already available to the refugees such as mobile phones, mobile apps for editing and simple desktop editing tools. We want to use the film workshop to go beyond the surface and let the refugees focus their storyline on the human conditions and values seen from their perspective. 

 

What We can do with Your Help

All the money raised will go to the refugee project 100%. For €150 you can pay for a refugee to participate in our film workshop.The cost for a film screening is €500 and the cost for building the activity center is €15,000. Every € you donate can prevent someone from becoming radicalized and build a foundation for future communities free from fear and wants.

Also, check out our perks. This is our Thank You! from the team for supporting us.

 

Other ways you can help

We are grateful for even €1 in donations, but we also know that it's not always possible to donate money. You can still help us reach our goal by spreading the word to your friends, family and network. Use the Indiegogo share tools to share our crowdfunding campaign. Show your support by commenting and let us know what you think. Feedback and comments are helpful.

 

The Team

 

Passion & Experience: Hebah and Fadi have between them more than 15 years of experience in humanitarian aid work, working for NGOs in the Middle East on health, youth, refugees and poverty. Cvetelina ("Lina") is an economist and worked for various political think-tanks on issues ranging from globalization, income inequality to international debt. Maureen is still a student with a specialization in the relationship between cultural heritage and film and human rights. Pierre worked on a number of Hollywood blockbusters before shooting and directing two documentaries. Nicolai ("Nico") and Boris are the two lawyers on the team with Nico having managed another nonprofit in the film and human rights sector before Roots. Boris makes sure everything we do is above board and fully legal.

Support refugees build a better future 
Help us break the narrative that underpin conflicts and the cycle of violence by challenging the underlying rationale through film. Let's empower the refugees by giving them a voice through their own films and documentaries; produced by them, for them and shared with us all.
 
The Challenge

[Armed] conflicts are too often pushed by narratives that provide a rationale to commit atrocities that people otherwise would reject. When displaced people are forced to coexist with nothing to do it often strengthens, or reinforce, the narratives that led to the conflict in the first place. Conflicts escalate and explode, or they are carried with the refugees back home once they return, providing fertile soil for renewed conflicts and future exodus. It becomes a cycle of violence that never seems to end. The question is - what can we do to help stop this cycle.

story:
Short Summary

The European Campaign for Human Rights for the people of Afghanistan (ECHRA) promotes and defends the human rights of the people of Afghanistan wherever they are. 

Millions of refugees have left Afghanistan. Many live in hardship in Pakistan, Iran, others try to reach Europe. We know that some do not make it. For those who reach Greece, many are detained. They can be in detention for months, even if they have a health problem. Even if they apply for asylum they can find it hard to be released because they have no permanent address. Yet there is usually no possibility of return to Afghanistan.

There are also many women and children from Afghanistan who arrive in Greece alone and end up destitute and living on the streets.

We want to help. 

We want to provide short term accommodation, for a month. A place to rest, wash, play, come to terms with the journey and try to get a foothold for the next important steps in life. 

We will help those who wish to stay in Greece to register, sort out their documents, help them contact relatives in Europe, plan for their future. 

#GREEKGUESTHOUSE                                          #LETSHELPEACHOTHER

What We Need & What You Get

This is the first push in our Campaign. We are aiming to raise £500.

We are already helping one family per month from donations collected locally in the UK. 

An extra £500 will allow us to help at least two families in May and another two in June with a month's accommodation, advice and support. 

In the longer term, we want to have our own Guesthouse for refugees from Afghanistan in Greece. 

We can rent a premises and help up to 8 refugees from Afghanistan per month for just 1,000 Euros per month. We are sure that once you see the benefits of our Guesthouse for the individuals we help, you will agree, and we can achieve this together! 

The major perk is that you get to change an individual's life at a crucial moment for them. 

If you are a woman living on the streets in Greece with small children, a month's accommodation and help to register and find support in Greece or from family overseas can literally be the difference between life and death for you and your family. 

If you are a young man who left Afghanistan because it wasn't safe for you, if you faced danger and death to find a better life, and you have been behind bars for months and do not know when you will be released, or if you have just been released and  you have nowhere to go, a shower, a bed and a chat can mean the world.

We do have other perks too, of course. See our Perks page for more information.

Finally, if we do not receive £500, then we can still use all the money raised to help people - however small. It costs around 100 Euros to provide a room for a month so however much or little you are able to donate, every single penny/cent will be used to help refugees from Afghanistan who need a helping hand to take their first steps towards a better future. 

The Impact

We started helping refugees from Afghanistan through our Greek Guesthouse in December. 

Zahara's family was the first we helped. Zahara and her three children had nowhere to go. She and one child became ill and had to go to hospital whilst her two other children stayed with another refugee family. When she was released from hospital we provided accommodation for her family for a month so they had somewhere warm and safe. We helped her get in touch with her family in Germany who were able to help her further.

We have also been helping Ferishta. Ferishta managed to get to Greece against all the odds with her four children nearly 7 years ago. She applied for asylum under the old system and is still waiting for it to be processed. Three of her children are minors and in care in different places in Greece. She and her 15 year old son were homeless. She is working at the market for 5 Euros a day. Her husband is in a second EU country but he has had his fingerprints taken in a third, and is fighting deportation. So it is unclear if she will be able to join him, or where that may be or when. With a room and somewhere stable to live, she can visit her children and start to think about rebuilding her life.

Every 100 Euros we raise will mean we can help another family.

Risks & Challenges

I suppose you may think that a month's accommodation is not enough, or that we are only helping small numbers of people. You are right, but we are doing what we can and that is important. Every person we help off the streets is a person who has a chance to go on to build a better future for themselves, their children, their family, Europe and Afghanistan. You can help us give that chance with any donation, however small.

There is a challenge that people will not be able to move on after a month. We are helping the most needy so in some cases it will not be possible to help people find other sources of support in that time. Do not worry, we are not in the business of returning people to the streets. If people need longer we will give them longer. A month is our aim, as we want to help as many people as possible but we do not want to return anyone to destitution. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with a donation but think this is a good idea, please, please, please tell all your friends, families, post on social networks and make some noise! Use the Indiegogo share tools. Be nice to someone on the street. Kiss your family. Have a lovely day.

story:
According to the United Nations it is estimated that approximately 1.6 billion people live in substandard housing and 100 million people are homeless globally, by poverty, wars and natural disasters. Moreover we have an ever-growing world population. We are also in the middle of an economic and environmental crises. This means we are not capable of solving this problem by conventional building; a fundamental breakthrough in housing is needed.

Some people close their eyes, some people don’t know what to do or how to help and some people take action. So can you!



Who are we?
Buildbag is a company that has developed a practical and sustainable solution to the global housing shortage.

 "I decided to dedicate my life to develop housing solutions for the underprivileged."  Marlon Kratz (Buildbag CEO) 
Together with a team of passionate Dutch professionals from different disciplines we invested six full years to create, develop and test a solution to the growing global housing shortage. We are convinced that this is a real breakthrough!

Marlon Kratz (left) in conversation with Dutch Minister of Economic Affairs.


What is Buildbag?
Buildbag is a revolutionary building-bag to build environmentally friendly, affordable and safe homes. They are specially developed to be filled with local raw materials like sand or soil, creating constructional building blocks.

Buildbags can be stacked on top of one another like bricks and easily linked together. Walls and homes build of Buildbags are temporary. By finishing them with a layer of plaster they become permanent.

Buildbags are easy to use, 100% recyclable, and the filling can be reused without processing or simply returned to nature.

Advantages of Buildbag
- 100% sustainable
- 100% recyclable
- Uses local raw materials
- Affordable
- Easy and quick to build
- No heavy equipment needed
- Easy and low-costs transport

Why do we need your donation?

Up until now we produced a small series of Buildbags and realized a pilot home.



Buildbag test-lab at RDM Campus in Rotterdam, The Netherlands.

With your donation we will start up the mass production of Buildbags and build demo projects in corporation with governments and (aid)organizations in several countries around the world for example Mexico, Haiti, Somalia and Southern Africa and Turkey. (Syrian refugees)

In addition we strive to establish a foundation which builds hospitals, orphanages, schools and homes for the poorest people of the world.


Why is the Buildbag concept so important?
By building with Buildbags we can overcome the economic and environmental restraints and enable future generations to reuse the same raw materials for new buildings.

Just imagine: Together we can help millions of people with safe homes!
Buildbag, Building with Nature..

Challenges

We have to convince governments, (aid) organizations and companies that Buildbag can enable them to solve the chronic housing shortage and acute housing disasters in a faster and more sustainable way.

Note
"Poor living conditions lead to poor health, which in turn limits a family’s ability to earn an income. Education and healthcare are not free in many countries and so a limited income means that these are jeopardized; consequently, a family’s ability to escape poverty is reduced. Poverty housing perpetuates the poverty cycle for generations"

(Source Habitat for Humanity)

Other ways you can help
You can help us by creating attention for the global housing shortage and by sharing our social media campaign with many others.

BuildBag, Building with nature!

story:
These Trees Are Made of Blood

We are the co-creators of These Trees Are Made of Blood, a piece of political-cabaret theatre that reimagines life under the brutal right-wing dictatorship of Argentina during the 1970's and 80's, during which an estimated 30,000 "subversives" were Disappeared in a concerted act of state-sponsored terrorism. The story is based upon the real-life struggles of Las Madres de Plaza de Mayo (The Mothers of the Plaza de Mayo) who risked daily persecution, torture and death to fight for justice for their Disappeared children. Their story is one of ordinary people whose extraordinary courage eventually led to the fall of one of the most notorious dictatorships in history.

We have been working on this piece since Director Amy Draper originally brought us together in 2012 to begin workshopping ideas for the show. In 2015, the first professional production was presented at the Southwark Playhouse, combining an original score, magic, cabaret and theatre to recreate one mother's journey into the dark underbelly of the Junta in a desperate search for her disappeared daughter.

What people said about the show...

"This exceptional political satire will be difficult to forget." THE UPCOMING

"A quite extraordinary piece of theatre ... absolutely compelling to watch”THE PUBLIC REVIEWS

"Darren Clark's compositions are boisterous and the band plays brilliantly.' TIME OUT

"A brave and important theatrical work...London does not see political, polemic Cabaret such as These Trees Are Made Of Blood very often." BRITISH THEATRE

"An outstanding people play exploring the human condition." EVERYTHING THEATRE

"The superb effort of the cast in telling such a harrowing story was rewarded, on the night of our visit, by a standing ovation and quite a few damp eyes. Theatre doesn’t get much more immersive than that" LONDONIST

"A carefully constructed piece of theatre and Amy Draper takes on bold and powerful choices with Paul Jenkins‘ formidable play text." THEATRE FULL STOP

"An unnerving, yet absolutely captivating portrait of the atrocities committed in Argentina." SOUNDS AND COLOURS

"An immersive and shocking piece. Expect the unexpected." WEST END FRAME

"A powerful, compelling musical satire...It deserves a wider audience as evidenced by a standing ovation from a packed house.” LONDONTHEATRE1

"The score is every bit as catchy and profound as anything you’ll see in the West End and would draw worthy comparisons with ‘Les Miserables’. Darren Clark should be applauded for being able to pull together such dark themes in his music and lyrics in a way that doesn’t overwhelm." UK THEATRE NETWORK

Why we need your help...

The original show (produced by Jim Croxford for Theatre Bench) premiered at Southwark Playhouse in April 2015 to critical and public acclaim. We built the show (with our incredibly talented and dedicated cast!) in just three weeks based on three years of devised workshops, writing and rewriting and Amy's research trip to Argentina. 

We were very proud of what we managed to achieve but we believe that the show could be even stronger with some reworking, using what we learned from our first run to tighten the narrative and improve the structure. Since the last production of the show closed we have been working very hard to do this but without promise of another production...

We have now been given an incredible chance to remount the production this summer for a 4-week run at The Arcola Theatre, one of London's finest Off-West End venues. Developing a piece of theatre like this takes considerable time and money, and we are fortunate that the Arcola Theatre is providing alot of support for the production. But in order to make the show as powerful as we believe it can be we need your help.

Your support at this stage of the project will help us to secure the future of the show, both at the Arcola and, with any luck, in further opportunities to tell this important story.

How much do we need and where will your money go?

We are aiming to raise a total of £7,500 which will go towards:

  • Reworking the script, songs and story for the revised version of the show.
  • Set Design so that the designer can most effectively reimagine the show for the main house at The Arcola Theatre
  • A movement director who will help us create some stunning visual images as part of the show.

Other ways you can help

We appreciate that for many of you it won't be the right time to donate financially, but you can certainly still help us out! If you believe that the project is worth shouting about then please do... this is by far the most important thing you can do to help ensure that we reach our target... 

  • Tweet about the campaign using the link on this page and @thesetreesshow #thesetrees
  • Share it on Facebook and Instagram
  • Tell your parents, grandparents, friends and distant relatives about the project. Again, even if they don't have the means to support us, they might know someone who does...
  • Put us in touch with any contacts in the press and any friends who blog regularly.
  • Put us in touch with anyone you think might be able to help us.

Thank you to one and all who (in whatever way) help us to rework this show so that we can tell the incredible story of the Mothers of the Plaza de Mayo in the way it deserves to be told. 

Our enormous thanks go to the Arcola Theatre for providing us with this incredible opportunity to bring this story to a wider audience.

But in order to make the show as powerful as we believe it can be we need your help.
Your support at this stage of the project will help us to secure the future of the show, both at the Arcola and, with any luck, in further opportunities to tell this important story.
How much do we need and where will your money go?
We are aiming to raise a total of £7,500 which will go towards:

Reworking the script, songs and story for the revised version of the show.
Set Design so that the designer can most effectively reimagine the show for the main house at The Arcola Theatre
A movement director who will help us create some stunning visual images as part of the show.


Other ways you can help
We appreciate that for many of you it won't be the right time to donate financially, but you can certainly still help us out! If you believe that the project is worth shouting about then please do... this is by far the most important thing you can do to help ensure that we reach our target... 

Tweet about the campaign using the link on this page and @thesetreesshow #thesetrees
Share it on Facebook and Instagram
Tell your parents, grandparents, friends and distant relatives about the project. Again, even if they don't have the means to support us, they might know someone who does...
Put us in touch with any contacts in the press and any friends who blog regularly.
Put us in touch with anyone you think might be able to help us.

Thank you to one and all who (in whatever way) help us to rework this show so that we can tell the incredible story of the Mothers of the Plaza de Mayo in the way it deserves to be told. Our enormous thanks go to the Arcola Theatre for providing us with this incredible opportunity to bring this story to a wider audience.

story:
Our Credibility

Why should you trust us to pull this off? Well, our small team did a successful proof of concept project last year with minimal resources, and during the process we collected evidence that this was a service people found both interesting and helpful. 
If you agree with us that harm reduction can save lives, you'll agree that the InfoScreens need to be at Shambhala again this year.

But don't let us tell you why, the feedback we collected after Shambhala 2016 speaks for itself:

  • Read the 2016 summary & evaluation
    While it was still fresh in our minds, we recorded some thoughts and ran a survey to collect data from crew, volunteers, and guests about what would have made the project better. All this great feedback has been incorporated into the plan for 2017.
     
  • Review the 2016 content 
    The slides displayed last year were so awesome! Lots of smart folks in the drug-checking and harm reduction world collaborated to put these together. We hope to make them even more informative and valuable this year, while keeping the tone fun and lighthearted rather than resorting to scare tactics. 

    Would you like to help create content for the InfoScreens? Deadline is July 28th!
    Click here to get in touch and access the 2017 content.
     

What We Need

Most of the equipment that was donated to ANKORS last year is still available and will be re-used, this includes several iPads that were used to drive the displays and Apple TVs to broadcast the signal wirelessly. So we don't require a lot of money this year:

Goal #1 : Obtain bigger, brighter, weatherproof screens

We need to purchase larger displays and mounting hardware,
and ensure that the displays are sufficiently weatherproofed.
The umbrellas last year were cute, but not very effective.

Goal #2: Display on-site drug checking results & trends in real-time

How great would it be to replace the whiteboards with easy to read
results on a screen, airport-arrivals style? The whiteboards get
filthy and can be difficult to read, the screens wouldn't.
We would need top-quality WiFi for this to happen.

*UPDATE* We trialled this at Astral Harvest and it worked great!
 

Can we do it...? Yes we can!

And here's how:

By donating to this campaign,
sharing the campaign with your festie-buddies,
contributing to the content, and supporting harm reduction in your community!

Feeling super generous and harm reduction-y?
Check out this important campaign that also needs your help!

ANKORS Harm Reduction Initiative

It's up to Shambhala guests, volunteers, & crew
—all of us—
to make projects like this happen and
keep our community well-informed, safe,
and ALIVE.

story:
Short Summary

We didn’t start Yabal because we thought there was an urgent need for more textile accessories in the market... instead, Yabal began because there was a need for jobs, specifically in two rural communities in the highlands of Guatemala that had been displaced during Hurricane Stan in 2005. These communities have high rates of illiteracy, very few job skills, are rurally isolated, and most of all, they do not own their own farmland, thus they depend on money to buy all their food and basic needs.

But… they are also communities that have a rich 5,000 year-old weaving tradition, the Mayan back-strap loom. And this is what we decided to focus on to build a Fair Trade business together given the many limitations in their lives.

Yabal currently supports around 60 indigenous women artisans through our fair trade ethical accessories line which we sell both retail and wholesale to stores in the US and Europe. These products allow our women weavers to earn a liveable income in order to support their families. 

Despite the challenges they face, the women we partner with are an incredibly fun group of artists, business women, and mothers that have hope for a better future… and that is exactly what our name Yabal means, a k’iche’ word meaning “hope”. 

All donations and all profits from the sale of Yabal products are used to fund social projects. We currently fund a scholarship program for children of the women weavers,  micro-credit loans to allow families to start businesses or rent farmland, maternity leave payments for pregnant weavers, and a women’s small business training program to teach women new skills in order to start their own businesses and earn extra income.

We’d like to invite YOU to be part of this incredible project!

What We Need & What You Get

In order to keep this important project going, we need YOUR help! We depend on your donations and product purchases to provide important jobs and social programs for these women. In return for your donation, we would like to send you one of our beautiful Yabal products- Fair Trade and handmade with love by these amazing artisans from our newest 2017 collection!

With your donation, we can do the following:

  • $1000= Fund the initial production of products for our 2017 collection so that we can start growing our inventory in order to fulfill orders
  • $1000= Print product catalogs for potential wholesale customers
  • $2000+ = Fund our Women’s Small Business Training Program. This year, we’d like to offer the following workshops and programs:
    • Oyster mushroom growing and selling workshops 
    • Family vegetable gardens
    • Fruit tree donations and jam-making workshops
    • Crochet and sewing classes
    • Pastry making
    • Business classes, such as, marketing, budgeting, basic math for business, customer service, and sales 

Below are the product perks you can choose as a Thank YOU for your donation. These are all brand-spanking-new products from our 2017 collection:

 

The Impact

A little can go a long way. We are a small organization and we use all resources and donations in the most efficient way possible. Our dream is to eventually be able to create more jobs for the women in these communities and be able to fund all of our social programs through sales alone. However, in order to reach that goal, we need your help along the way!

As an ethical Fair Trade business, we pay fair wages and invest in long term relationships with our artisans. In the current fashion world, this can be seen as a liability, as we are not able to cut costs through wages in order to make our business profitable quicker... 

But we believe that business should be different. Fair trade is about bottom-up businesses and using our current economic trade system to actually, for once, help the producers first. This deeper commitment to uplifting producers makes this work doubly hard. When our artisans make a mistake or when clients would like products that are cheaper or faster to make, we won’t just jump ship and find a new artisan group to work with. We have a long-term commitment with our artisan groups to advance hand-in-hand together. Fair Trade is about People and Profit and about consumers choosing to support instead of exploit workers around the world. Thank you for giving us a chance and lending your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount you are able to give goes a long way! But we also need your help to spread the word. You would help us out a TON by doing any of the following:

  • Share this campaign on facebook, twitter, linkedin, your blog, etc
  • Personally email our campaign to your friends and family 
  • Go online and shop! www.yabalhandicrafts.com

Go online and shop! www.yabalhandicrafts.com

story:
We're Jan, Alicja and Conor, a designer, a photographer and a writer, from Germany, Poland and Ireland.

We discovered an interesting historical detail regarding the first European refugees to arrive at Ellis Island. Instead of being greeted with razor wire, flashlights and the threat of horrific family separation, the Americans gave them freshly-made ice cream. 

Inspired by this gesture, we created an ice cream homage to the Statue of Liberty, called Liberty Lick.


Right now we're building a crazy ice cream truck in a garage in America. We're looking for your help to fill the truck with ice cream, that we'll hand out to Americans, as we travel across the land during the midterm elections this Autumn.

Americans helped Europeans during a time when fascism was pulling our continent apart.

Now it's time for Europe to help America.


For every one euro you donate, we'll give one American an ice cream for free.

 

We are documenting everything we're doing, from planning our trip to making our own ice cream, and we will turn this project into a movie, so you can see exactly how much work and time we put into creating Liberty Lick.

With your help we can unify all Americans, and remind them...

Liberty only tastes good, when everyone gets a scoop!

 

If you limited your world view to what politicians say, you might think that the only things uniting people from different countries were trade, competition and profit. We disagree with this. We feel that America and Europe are family, and that the divisive language of world leaders is not reflective of that bond.

With your help, we can help unify both sides of the Atlantic, and remind Americans that we're all in this together.

For just €1, we can give ice cream to the entire population of Buford, Wyoming. Thanks to you, we've got that guy covered.

Donate €10, and we can give ice cream to two basketball teams - assuming nobody lets it drop!

With €250, we can treat everyone in Hyder, Alaska. Even the bears!

And if we manage to get €30,000, we can reach 1.83333% of all Americans.

The more people we can introduce to Liberty and the more conversations we start, the greater the change we can bring to America.

We don't know if we can heal the world through ice cream, but we will at least try and awaken its most powerful nation, and remind them what true freedom means.

We believe in Liberty, because no one is free while others are oppressed.

Help us licking for freedom!

Keep up to date with our progress #libertylick and click here to follow us on instagram

 

 

If you can't donate, there are still ways that you can help us bringing liberty back to America. It's important that we spread our message online. Become a Facebook fan, follow us on Instagram and Twitter. Just because we can't reach people in real life, doesn't mean we can't reach them at all.

Thank you for the love.

#libertylick

 

 

Things can and do go wrong. Our truck might break down. Our soft serve ice cream machine might fall apart before we even leave the garage. We may hit a low-lying bridge or never come down from our sugar high. There are numerous risks and potential pitfalls when it comes to crowdfunding, and ice cream.

But even if we have to walk across America, with a cooler box strapped to our shoulders, we'll still fulfill our promise to convert your donations into ice cream for Americans.

Rest assured, we'll keep you updated each step, and each scoop, along the way.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who Are We?

Helping Hands is a group of college students from the University of Tennessee assigned to work with a non-profit organization called Volunteer Ministry Center. Our group members are Katherine Ruttenbur, Taylor Tinnin, Jiaxin Li, Michael Padrta, and Jaqueria Stout.

What’s VMC?

Volunteer Ministry Center or VMC is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping those who are experiencing homelessness in Knoxville, Tennessee. VMC helps find permanent supportive housing for those experiencing homelessness and provides services to prevent homelessness. VMC provides services such as housing, dental, and other resources for those experiencing homelessness. 

Why Help the Homeless?

Homelessness has been an issue dating back to the 1800s. The increasing economic differences in the 21st century have escalated the situation. Homelessness is the result of poverty, economic regression, and social crises such as the pandemic we are experiencing now. For communities like Knoxville, homelessness has brought many negative impacts such as increasing the crime rate, occupancy of public spaces, etc. 

The pandemic has affected those experiencing homelessness drastically. Individuals who experience homelessness lack personal protective gear, a safe environment for quarantine, and access to testing. According to our interview with their CEO, the pandemic has affected the way VMC operates. Due to Covid-19, the VMC has had to suspend its onsite volunteer programs to ensure the safety of both volunteers as well as the homeless. 

How Can Your Funds Help?

The funds collected during this campaign will be sent directly to VMC once the campaign is over. The funds will be used to support current running programs including the Guest House, used for quarantine purposes. The Guest House was created to help those experiencing homelessness during the pandemic. Over 200 hundred people have benefited from the Guest House since April 2020. The Guest House helps those experiencing homelessness by providing necessary supplies for quarantine such as food and electricity.

Our Goal

We hope to reach a large audience therefore we can show individuals how important it is to support the VMC. We hope to bring awareness to the VMC and to those who do not know about individuals experiencing homelessness in Knoxville, Tennessee. The programs the VMC offers have provided unique perspectives to examine the relationship between individual community members and others as a whole. For example, the Guest Housing program indicates while people protect themselves during the pandemic, it is equally important to ensure other people’s safety against the pandemic.

If you pledged, you will get

VMC has generously provided signed books for us to raise funds, and we also came up with our own perks. 

5 dollars, social media shout-out from our group.

25 dollars, a locally made candle. 

50 dollars, signed books from VMC.

Each higher tier includes all perks from the previous tier.

If you want to know more about how you can help, please go to VMC’s website: Volunteer Ministry Center Knoxville | Preventing & Ending Homelessness https://www.vmcinc.org/
