story:
Overview

 

Our aim through Unstoppable girls  is to start a self-defence and self-confidence program for girls in schools in Bhatipura, a village in Western Uttar Pradesh. Our solution is to teach young girls self-defence moves that can help them get out of dangerous situations.
But this is not enough! It is essential that these girls become aware of themselves and their abilities, boosting their own confidence. We propose to do this by talking about rights and opportunities, because the knowledge of oneself and of their capabilities abolishes the differences.
We want to guarantee girls the right integration in community and in schoold, as well as the chance for them to feel safe, wherever they are. 

Girls have the right to live their womanhood.

The problem of violence against women in India is ancient, just think that in 2014 only in Delhi there were 1700 rapes.

With your help we can guarantee girls integration and safety.

We will provide children a self-defence course with a certified trainer. 
We will also give girls whistles and pepper spray.

 

WHO WE ARE

 

We are HEEALS (Health, Education, Environment and Livelihood Society), a vibrant Indian non-profit aiming at building a self-sustained society in India, by empowering local communities with education, awareness and basic skills.

We are registered under Section 21 of 1860 Society Act with the Government of India, and most of our work is based on volunteering.                 

We particularly focus on children and we work a lot with schools in local villages and rural areas. We believe that education is a gift that can change children’s lives, and we deliver our messages through interactive activities such as Wall Painting, Posters Drawing, Drama, group and one to one discussions… ways that give children a real part to play in the betterment of their own lives. We plan to create international awareness about sanitation, menstrual hygiene, toilets and unsafe drinking water, and its effect on female education and health.

In particular we want to target those living in rural areas, urban slums, refugee camps and orphanages. Alongside our awareness campaign, we also want to ensure that communities are equipped to tackle these issues by providing things such as water purification tablets, water tanks, soap and sanitary towels for young girls.

 

PROPOSED BUDGET

 

How awesome would be your help:

with just 1$ or 1€ you could supply girls with enough pads to help her in starting their path towards a

free womanhood.

 

All of the money raised on this crowdfunding page will go directly to the project (including transport and logistics costs), and will allow us to impact the villages on a long-term basis by making sure that not only we carry out the project to its full extent, but also we will be able to return to the villages at a later date for monitoring and evaluation purposes.

If we do not raise the full of funding, we will go on with the little we have and also with the dedication of volunteers. For example, by restricting our project to less than eighteen schools. In the event of this scenario, our backers will be informed in detail about the changes, and will be provided with precise information about where their donation is going.

 

My enormous gratitude towards your help will be expressed through updates about the obtained results.

You can also see the fantastic  projects that our organization is planning and all great results we have already obtained through our web-site and blog.

 

Some of our work to raise awareness

Movie:  

AN END OF THE DARKNESS (ROSHNI STORY): https://vimeo.com/155237318

Menstrual Hygiene Day 2018 Celebrated at HEEAL Office #NOMORELIMITS https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=625m0_LDw7M

Documentary: HEEALS Documentary

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ips4rLV0Ug

The Curse : Taboos & Myths Related To Menstruation:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1iRlngOAsxo

HEEALS SUCCESS STORY :

http://heeals.org/entries/general/success-stories-

You can help us in many ways : contributing financially to our project budget; spreading the word to your family and friends (sharing this page, or talking about our action); or even by volunteering!

Let’s meet on our website: http://heeals.org/&nbsp;&nbsp;or Like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Heeals&nbsp;or&nbs... and tweet with us: https://twitter.com/heeals

 

THANKS FOR DONATING - HELP US MAKE A CHANGE

HELP US TO SPREAD THE WORD
story_txt: Overview Our aim through Unstoppable girls  is to start a self-defence and self-confidence program for girls in schools in Bhatipura, a village in Western Uttar Pradesh. Our solution is to teach young girls self-defence moves that can help them get out of dangerous situations.But this is not enough! It is essential that these girls become aware of themselves and their abilities, boosting their own confidence. We propose to do this by talking about rights and opportunities, because the knowledge of oneself and of their capabilities abolishes the differences.We want to guarantee girls the right integration in community and in schoold, as well as the chance for them to feel safe, wherever they are. Girls have the right to live their womanhood.The problem of violence against women in India is ancient, just think that in 2014 only in Delhi there were 1700 rapes.With your help we can guarantee girls integration and safety.We will provide children a self-defence course with a certified trainer. We will also give girls whistles and pepper spray. WHO WE ARE We are HEEALS (Health, Education, Environment and Livelihood Society), a vibrant Indian non-profit aiming at building a self-sustained society in India, by empowering local communities with education, awareness and basic skills.We are registered under Section 21 of 1860 Society Act with the Government of India, and most of our work is based on volunteering.                 We particularly focus on children and we work a lot with schools in local villages and rural areas. We believe that education is a gift that can change children’s lives, and we deliver our messages through interactive activities such as Wall Painting, Posters Drawing, Drama, group and one to one discussions… ways that give children a real part to play in the betterment of their own lives. We plan to create international awareness about sanitation, menstrual hygiene, toilets and unsafe drinking water, and its effect on female education and health.In particular we want to target those living in rural areas, urban slums, refugee camps and orphanages. Alongside our awareness campaign, we also want to ensure that communities are equipped to tackle these issues by providing things such as water purification tablets, water tanks, soap and sanitary towels for young girls. PROPOSED BUDGET How awesome would be your help:with just 1$ or 1€ you could supply girls with enough pads to help her in starting their path towards afree womanhood. All of the money raised on this crowdfunding page will go directly to the project (including transport and logistics costs), and will allow us to impact the villages on a long-term basis by making sure that not only we carry out the project to its full extent, but also we will be able to return to the villages at a later date for monitoring and evaluation purposes.If we do not raise the full of funding, we will go on with the little we have and also with the dedication of volunteers. For example, by restricting our project to less than eighteen schools. In the event of this scenario, our backers will be informed in detail about the changes, and will be provided with precise information about where their donation is going. My enormous gratitude towards your help will be expressed through updates about the obtained results.You can also see the fantastic  projects that our organization is planning and all great results we have already obtained through our web-site and blog. Some of our work to raise awarenessMovie:  AN END OF THE DARKNESS (ROSHNI STORY): https://vimeo.com/155237318Menstrual Hygiene Day 2018 Celebrated at HEEAL Office #NOMORELIMITS https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=625m0_LDw7MDocumentary: HEEALS Documentaryhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ips4rLV0UgThe Curse : Taboos & Myths Related To Menstruation:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1iRlngOAsxoHEEALS SUCCESS STORY :http://heeals.org/entries/general/success-stories-You can help us in many ways : contributing financially to our project budget; spreading the word to your family and friends (sharing this page, or talking about our action); or even by volunteering!Let’s meet on our website: http://heeals.org/&nbsp;&nbsp;or Like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Heeals&nbsp;or&nbs... and tweet with us: https://twitter.com/heeals THANKS FOR DONATING - HELP US MAKE A CHANGEHELP US TO SPREAD THE WORD

story:
Short Summary

We're a grassroots group, made up of pro-indy Catalans and Scots living in both nations. We feel it is important to give a voice to those of us who support freedom for our nations, because we wish to see Scotland and Catalonia governed by the people who care most about our future. And that's why we need to spread the word about our cause! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

With just £5 we can pay for leaflets, create online ads to reach people across the globe and raise awareness of our cause. Any donation will have a great impact...

 

The Impact

With your help we can reach thousands of people who probably don't know what's happening in Catalonia, and we will make them know the truth and know the repressive and fascist attitude of the Spanish Government.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

OK, so not everyone can afford to donate, but you can still help us by:

· Sharing this campaign with your relatives and friends

· Get out the word about the Catalan cause. Spread the word, join our Facebook group, "like" our Facebook page, follow us on Twitter, etc.

· Contributing to the debate! If you're a proud supporter of the democratic pro-independence movement you can attend demonstrations, talk to your family, friends and neighbours - don't be afraid to get the word out.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story: Al Dais health centre is one of the community initiatives that need a huge help and full support. This centre required to restoration and re-equipment in there clinics, doctor's offices, urgent care centres and ambulatory surgery centres, serve as first point of contact with a health professional and provide outpatient medical, nursing, dental, and other types of care services. Al Dais health centre is located in Al Dais village which is one of Badan district in Ibb province in Yemen. Inability to restoration or re-equipment of this centre is due to the country considered within the list of the poorest countries in the world. As well as, the country in the midst of massive civil war that has caused a catastrophic humanitarian crisis which goes a long way to explaining the country’s place since 2014. Finally, we need a fast response and intervention to help this centre to provide medical health care for more than 10,000 of people were lived in Al Dais village who needs medical help for some emerging and re-emerging infectious diseases [Cholera, Diphtheria, Soil Transmitted Helminth (STH) and other diseases]. Moreover, childhood vaccines [Chickenpox (varicella) vaccine. Diphtheria, Tetanus, and Pertussis vaccine (DTaP) Hepatitis A vaccine (HepA)] and other medical care services.

story:
Pe 30 septembrie 2018 mii de persoane se vor aduna în Piața Marii Adunări Naționale la startul celei de-a IV-a ediții a Chisinau International Marathon. Fiecare dintre ele va alerga 5, 10, 21 sau 42 KM pe străzile capitalei Moldovei. Iar câteva zeci au hotărât să dea o și mai mare valoare participării lor la Maraton, alegând să alerge pentru Hospices of Hope Moldova, pentru cei care se confruntă zilnic cu o boală incurabilă și consecințele acesteia. 

Hospices of Hope activează în Republica Moldova încă din 2008, dezvoltând servicii de Îngrijire Paliativă* la nivel național prin intermediul organizațiilor locale. Unul dintre cele mai mari și ambițioase proiecte dezvoltate până în prezent, este Rețeaua Națională de Servicii de Îngrijire Paliativă, care, prin intermediul a cinci echipe multidisciplinare, oferă servicii mobile de asistență medico-socială gratuite copiilor și adulților ce suferă de boli incurabile în cinci raioane ale țării: Cahul, Taraclia, Orhei, Soroca și Ocnița. 

Mai mult ca atât, Hospices of Hope Moldova este principalul furnizor de pungi pentru stomă și accesorii necesare, care sunt oferite Institutului Oncologic și distribuite la nivel național. De asemenea, în cadrul proiectului, peste patruzeci de persoane implicate au fost instruite astfel încât aceștia să poată oferi servicii profesionale de îngrijire paliativă celor ce le necesită.

De la un an de la lansarea rețelei, datorită susținerii partenerilor de dezvoltare internaționali și contribuției donatorilor locali, proiectul Hospices of Hope a reușit să aducă confort și alinare, prin serviciile mobile, la peste 500 de persoane care suferă de boli incurabile în regiunile țării, cât și familiilor acestora, și prin ajutor umanitar la peste o mie de persoane care necesită pungi pentru stomă în toată republica.

Toate serviciile oferite de către echipă sunt gratuite pentru beneficiarii acestora. 

Cei câteva zeci de alergători care s-au alăturat campaniei #RunForHope, pe lângă provocarea de a alerga pe 30 septembrie, au acceptat și provocarea de a colecta minimum 100 EUR (115 USD) pentru îndeplinirea misiunii Hospices of Hope în Moldova. 

Pentru ce vor fi utilizate fondurile: 

Donează și tu, dă-le curaj alergătorilor RunForHope să ajungă la linia de finiș și ajută-i pe cei care au nevoie de îngrijire, alinare și speranță!

 

*Ce înseamnă Îngrijire Paliativă și care este rolul acesteia:

Îngrijirea Paliativă este acel tip de îngrijire care îmbunătățește calitatea vieții pacienților și familiilor acestora, care se confruntă cu problemele asociate unei boli amenințătoare de viață, prin prevenirea și înlăturarea suferinței, prin identificarea precoce, evaluarea corectă și tratamentul durerii și al altor probleme fizice, psiho-sociale și spirituale. Scopul îngrijirii paliative este asigurarea unei calități a vieții cât mai bune pentru bolnavi și familiile acestora. Îngrijirea Paliativă ajută atât pacientul să ducă o viață cât mai apropiată de cea normală până la moarte, cât și familia să facă față în timpul bolii pacientului și după decesul acestuia. 

************************************************************

#RunForHope Team members will run for patients with incurable diseases in the Republic of Moldova. Support them!

On September 30, 2018, thousands of people will gather in the Great National Assembly Square for the 4th edition of Chisinau International Marathon. Each of them will run 5, 10, 21 or 42 KM on the streets of the capital of Moldova. And several dozen have decided to give even greater value to their participation in the Marathon, choosing to run for Hospices of Hope Moldova for those who face daily incurable diseases and its consequences.

Hospices of Hope has been working in Moldova since 2008 and has been developing palliative care projects through local organizations. One of our biggest and most ambitious project so far has been the National Network of Palliative Care Services that offers with its five multidisciplinary palliative care teams, free mobile services for children and adults suffering of incurable illnesses in five counties/raioane: Cahul, Taraclia, Orhei, Soroca and Ocnita.

Furthermore, Hospices of Hope Moldova has been the main supplier of stoma bags and accessories for the Oncological Institute and for the country itself. We also managed to train over forty medical and non-medical practitioners involved in the project in order to ensure professional care for those in need.

Within a year since the launch of the network, with the help of our international development partners and local donors our project has managed to have over 500 cancer and non-cancer incurable patients into care in the raioane plus their families and over thousands of stoma bags beneficiaries throughout the country.

All the services provided by the Hospices of Hope Moldova team are free of charge for their beneficiaries.

All the runners who joined the #RunForHope campaign, along with the challenge to run on September 30, also accepted the challenge of collecting at least EUR 100 (USD 115) for the Hospice of Hope mission in Moldova.

The collected funds will be used for:

5 EUR = the cost for bandaging a patient with severe wounds

25 EUR = approximate cost for 2 visits at a patient's home

50 EUR = cost for medications for 1 month for 10 patients

100 EUR = cost for the transportation to the patients for 1 month for 1 team

By donating, you will give courage to #RunForHope runners to reach the finish line and help those who need care, comfort and hope!

* What does Palliative Care mean and what is its role?

Palliative care is the type of care that improves the quality of life of patients and their families facing problems associated with a life-threatening disease. It prevents and eliminates their suffering through early identification, correct assessment and treatment of pain and other physical, psycho-social and spiritual issues. The goal of palliative care is to ensure the quality of life for the patients and their families. It helps both the patient to live as close to normal as possible, and the family to cope with the patient's illness and following bereavement.

story:
Hotel Vouchers 4 All¡± is the only COVID-19 prevention specific shelter in San Diego city that accepted children and those with disabilities since the beginning of the pandemic. ¡°Hotel Vouchers 4 All¡± is a project in partnership with San Diego Youth Development Foundation (501c3) which has been purely funded through grassroots donations and small community grants run entirely by volunteers

In our efforts to ¡°flatten the curve¡± through temporary homeless placement in socially distancing appropriate and hygienic hotel rooms we have provided temporary shelter for over 100 individuals while they transition to permanent housing, as well as supported over 200 people in connections to food and resources.

story:
Overview

 

Our aim through WonderGirl is to start a self-defence and self-confidence program for girls in schools in Bhatipura, a village in Western Uttar Pradesh. Our solution is to teach young girls self-defence moves that can help them get out of dangerous situations.
But this is not enough! It is essential that these girls become aware of themselves and their abilities, boosting their own confidence. We propose to do this by talking about rights and opportunities, because the knowledge of oneself and of their capabilities abolishes the differences.
We want to guarantee girls the right integration in community and in schoold, as well as the chance for them to feel safe, wherever they are. 

Girls have the right to live their womanhood.

The problem of violence against women in India is ancient, just think that in 2014 only in Delhi there were 1700 rapes.

With your help we can guarantee girls integration and safety.

We will provide children a self-defence course with a certified trainer. 
We will also give girls whistles and pepper spray.

 

WHO WE ARE

 

We are HEEALS (Health, Education, Environment and Livelihood Society), a vibrant Indian non-profit aiming at building a self-sustained society in India, by empowering local communities with education, awareness and basic skills.

We are registered under Section 21 of 1860 Society Act with the Government of India, and most of our work is based on volunteering.                 

We particularly focus on children and we work a lot with schools in local villages and rural areas. We believe that education is a gift that can change children’s lives, and we deliver our messages through interactive activities such as Wall Painting, Posters Drawing, Drama, group and one to one discussions… ways that give children a real part to play in the betterment of their own lives. We plan to create international awareness about sanitation, menstrual hygiene, toilets and unsafe drinking water, and its effect on female education and health.

In particular we want to target those living in rural areas, urban slums, refugee camps and orphanages. Alongside our awareness campaign, we also want to ensure that communities are equipped to tackle these issues by providing things such as water purification tablets, water tanks, soap and sanitary towels for young girls.

 

PROPOSED BUDGET

 

How awesome would be your help:

with just 1$ or 1€ you could supply girls with enough pads to help her in starting their path towards a

free womanhood.

 

All of the money raised on this crowdfunding page will go directly to the project (including transport and logistics costs), and will allow us to impact the villages on a long-term basis by making sure that not only we carry out the project to its full extent, but also we will be able to return to the villages at a later date for monitoring and evaluation purposes.

If we do not raise the full of funding, we will go on with the little we have and also with the dedication of volunteers. For example, by restricting our project to less than eighteen schools. In the event of this scenario, our backers will be informed in detail about the changes, and will be provided with precise information about where their donation is going.

 

My enormous gratitude towards your help will be expressed through updates about the obtained results.

You can also see the fantastic  projects that our organization is planning and all great results we have already obtained through our web-site and blog.

 

Some of our work to raise awareness

Let’s meet on our website: http://heeals.org/  or Like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Heeals or follow and tweet with us: https://twitter.com/heeals

 

THANKS FOR DONATING - HELP US MAKE A CHANGE

HELP US TO SPREAD THE WORD
story_txt:
Overview
 
Our aim through WonderGirl is to start a self-defence and self-confidence program for girls in schools in Bhatipura, a village in Western Uttar Pradesh. Our solution is to teach young girls self-defence moves that can help them get out of dangerous situations.But this is not enough! It is essential that these girls become aware of themselves and their abilities, boosting their own confidence. We propose to do this by talking about rights and opportunities, because the knowledge of oneself and of their capabilities abolishes the differences.We want to guarantee girls the right integration in community and in schoold, as well as the chance for them to feel safe, wherever they are. 
Girls have the right to live their womanhood.

The problem of violence against women in India is ancient, just think that in 2014 only in Delhi there were 1700 rapes.
With your help we can guarantee girls integration and safety.
We will provide children a self-defence course with a certified trainer. We will also give girls whistles and pepper spray.
 
WHO WE ARE
 

We are HEEALS (Health, Education, Environment and Livelihood Society), a vibrant Indian non-profit aiming at building a self-sustained society in India, by empowering local communities with education, awareness and basic skills.
We are registered under Section 21 of 1860 Society Act with the Government of India, and most of our work is based on volunteering.                 
We particularly focus on children and we work a lot with schools in local villages and rural areas. We believe that education is a gift that can change children’s lives, and we deliver our messages through interactive activities such as Wall Painting, Posters Drawing, Drama, group and one to one discussions… ways that give children a real part to play in the betterment of their own lives. We plan to create international awareness about sanitation, menstrual hygiene, toilets and unsafe drinking water, and its effect on female education and health.
In particular we want to target those living in rural areas, urban slums, refugee camps and orphanages. Alongside our awareness campaign, we also want to ensure that communities are equipped to tackle these issues by providing things such as water purification tablets, water tanks, soap and sanitary towels for young girls.
 
PROPOSED BUDGET
 

How awesome would be your help:
with just 1$ or 1€ you could supply girls with enough pads to help her in starting their path towards a
free womanhood.
 
All of the money raised on this crowdfunding page will go directly to the project (including transport and logistics costs), and will allow us to impact the villages on a long-term basis by making sure that not only we carry out the project to its full extent, but also we will be able to return to the villages at a later date for monitoring and evaluation purposes.
If we do not raise the full of funding, we will go on with the little we have and also with the dedication of volunteers. For example, by restricting our project to less than eighteen schools. In the event of this scenario, our backers will be informed in detail about the changes, and will be provided with precise information about where their donation is going.
 
My enormous gratitude towards your help will be expressed through updates about the obtained results.
You can also see the fantastic  projects that our organization is planning and all great results we have already obtained through our web-site and blog.
 
Some of our work to raise awareness

story:
AlsalamAleikom/Hi, thanks to all of you who have visited this page. I'm Adel Hashem, a Yemeni humanitarian aid worker living in the capital of Yemen, Sanaa. I’m the executive director of Human Needs Development(HND).

Here is our HND’s yearly fundraising appeal for the holy month of Ramadan as we welcome in this blessed month once again this year of 2019. As we welcome this holy month again, we reflect on the sad fact that, from the youngest child to the elderly, our families in Yemen have faced endless hunger, displacement, malnutrition, indignity and despair every day for nearly 4 years of war.

Surely, you even haven't thought about buying medicine for your little girl and go without food tomorrow OR begging for people’s leftovers if you didn’t know when you’d eat again OR letting your little boy miss school so he could find food for his family????

Of course this is not a choice, this is a tragedy!! BUT unfortunately it’s also a brutal reality for our families in our Home, Yemen, right now.

 

“24 million” Yemeni people are urgently in need of humanitarian aid!!

 

With the ongoing war on Yemen – which is already one of the poorest countries in the region – tens of thousands of lives have been lost and over “20” million people don’t know where their next meal will come from. A country being starved by war is sadly now on the brink of famine.

With families facing ongoing war, disease and economic decline, an estimated “24” million people are now in need of humanitarian aid to survive – a figure so high that it is in fact the highest across the globe.

Yemen now officially hosts the world’s largest human-induced food security crisis.

Our Yemen’s families and communities have been torn apart and left without even the most basic of living essentials:

  • “19” million people need basic healthcare;
  • Almost “18” million people are in need of water and sanitation facilities;
  • Over “3” million people have been left displaced by airstrikes or clashes;
  • On the ground in Yemen, the situation is dire and things are getting worse each and every day. For our men, women and children across the country, finding their next meal is a growing challenge.

 

Since our establishment in 2016, we at Human Needs Development (HND) successfully have launched over “110” projects in most Yemeni urban and rural areas. Right now, we helped over “40,000” people in Yemen with most basic needs such as food, clean water, education and medicine.

 

During last holy month of Ramadan of 2018, we were able distribute about “650” food packages to “650” hungry families in various areas across Yemen. However, with your support we can help these communities in their hour of need during Ramadan 2019 as well.

 

Anyway, all collected amounts here will be used to purchase and deliver Ramadan food packages to most vulnerable families in Yemen. Families with big numbers of members, headed with females, orphans and those who are internally displaced will be prioritized.

Every Ramadan food package costs only ($30) and contains the following:

  • (20 KG) of flour;
  • (5 KG) of rice;
  • (5 KG) of sugar;
  • (2 KG) of dates;
  • (2 liters) of cooking oil.

 

All pictures and videos for the food packages distribution process will be posted here so we let know where we use the kind support of our donors like you.

However, we need your support to reach as many people as possible and widen our response during coming holy month of Ramadan 2019.

 

We can do more!! We must do more!!

Please DONATE now!!.

 

  • SOME PICTURES FOR OUR ACHIEVED PROJECTS:

MORE ABOUT US!!

HND is a non-profit Yemeni registered organization NO:(275/2016) based in the capital of Yemen, Sana’a. We vow to help create change by making a better living condition for the most war-affected people in our Home, Yemen. We help them with most life's basic needs such as foods, education and health. We help them regardless their different religions, sects, colors and regions.

FOR MORE ABOUT US AND THE PROJECTS WE SUCCESSFULLY ACHIEVED in Yemen, FEEL FREE TO VISIT OUR FACEBOOK PAGE OR TWITTER ACCOUNT PLEASE.

You also can write me as well on FACEBOOK, TWITTER or email me at adel.ha@gmx.com or Whatsapp at +967 737317170

 

CAN’T THANK YOU ENOUGH FOR YOUR SUPPORTING!!

story:
Short Summary

The purpose of this campaign is: 

  • To provide start-up funds for a public research project that will explore Earth-based food, medicine, and spiritual practices across the United States--especially practices and narratives that are under-represented, mis-represented, and unrepresented in dominant environmental and holistic health research
  • To help lay the foundational for a holistic health research institute committed to revolutionizing healthcare, holistic health research, and the relationship between human and environmental health.

Who am I?

I am an Earth-based researcher, lifestyle coach, and cultural creative with an interdisciplinary M.Phil in International Peace Studies and an interdisciplinary Ph.D. in Environmental Studies. My areas of expertise are environmental health and Earth-based healing systems; food system sustainability; creative and alternative research methodologies; and social psychology/political philosophy. 

 

What I Need

I'm raising $100,000.00. This will support:

  • a mobile living and work space and necessary amenities
  • technological requirements & support
  • promotion & outreach
  • travel costs
  • educational resources

 

The Impact

The Institute for Earth-Based Living:

  • Collects information and stories about Earth-based food, medicine, and spiritual practices and practitioners and shares them publicly in ways that are interesting and easy to understand
  • Contributes to which healing practices are legitimized and supported by employers and the government 
  • Understands how people actually support the health and wellness of themselves and their communities daily
  • Centers stories of American (and World) history and culture that are invisible or unrecognized in dominant American (and World) culture.
  • Unites people committed to healing and liberation from diverse backgrounds

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to make a contribution right now, fear not! There are lots of ways you can help:

  • SHARE this campaign with others via word of mouth and social media
  • Read and engage with my blog www.rosehiproadtrip.com and share with others
  • Like and share the pages "Institute for Earth-Based Living" and "Rose Hip Road Trip" on Facebook
  • Follow @rosehiproadtrip on Instagram
  • Subscribe to the Sunday Dinner Dispatch on www.rosehiproadtrip.com or through The Rose Hip Road Trip's Facebook Page
  • Join the Institute for Earth-Based Living's email list via the Institute for Earth Based Living's Facebook page
  • Invite me to speak to your school, organization, company, or community group about the project when I come to your area
  • Host a popup dinner when I come to your area
  • Support participants of the Rose Hip Road Trip--you can find that information via the website, Instagram, and Facebook

story:
Short Summary

My name is Virginia, I am a student of social work and pastoral care in college. Also I am a volunteer at Day Care Center in Kaunas (Lithuania) for homeless people.

When people see the homeless, they don't tend to see the humanity in them. They see them as problems, as being dirty or less than themselves. But I believe that everyone is part of the same human family and that we all deserve to be treated as such. There are lots of ways to help homeless people. I am donating my time for him. And I would like to create some more changes for homeless people. I‘m not alone in this project: there are also two social workers in the Day care center: Vitalija and Raimonda. We have decided to do something about it.

We believe that to help someone overcome their challenges and no longer be homeless they need 3 things:

1. Health

2. Shelter/security

3. Purpose

Most of organizations in Lithuania are only focusing on number 2, getting them into homeless shelters or affordable housing. However 80% of the homeless that stay in the shelters end up back on the street within a year. It is not a permanent solution.

The Day Care center is trying to address all three, as a more holistic approach, but especially to the first. Homeless people are at relatively high risk for a broad range of acute and chronic illnesses. Precise data on the prevalence of specific illnesses among homeless people compared with those among nonhomeless people are difficult to obtain, but there is a body of information indicating that homelessness is associated with a number of physical and mental problems.

What we need

We need cash donations to be able to buy the items that we have not been able to get donated.

Things that they are in immediate need of, such as: clean underwear, hygiene items, feminine supplies, many medicines, treatment costs and other things.

What if we all built a resource that would help change that? 

We believe that as we see them as valuable parts of society, as we listen to them, and encourage them to do better, that they will then be empowered to rise to the level that we see them at. If all we ever expect from and see, is a drug addict, then that’s all they ever will be. But if you see them as a brother, a friend, a hard worker, then it allows them to improve.

We believe that everyone should be treated fairly and as a human being.  I like to think of everyone as one big family.

This campaign will need your support and every cent makes a difference in a poor elderly's life. Your contribution will make a big difference!

Please donate what you can. Your financial pledge will help us make a positive impact in the lives of many.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, if you can't afford to help financially, you can still be a significant help by sharing our story on your Facebook, Twitter and your email lists. Thank you!

If you see a homeless person, please, try talking to them. See what their story is before being so quick to judge them. They may just teach you something. We have come to realize that there is a “pearl” inside of everyone including the homeless, and the longer you talk with someone and invest in your relationship, the more good that you are able to see in them. Please help us to bring out the good parts of these people.

Thank You :)

Please help us to bring out the good parts of these people.
Thank You :)

story: During a trip to the Puerto Rico, I found myself on the street of the place where I was staying, many dogs that were always hungry, I helped with something every time I went out to eat, but I knew that I would have to return and they would stay there hungry . then I met a person from the street who looked after them and also gave him food whenever he could. I want to send money to that person to keep feeding and caring for those dogs until I can return with my savings and seek shelter. please help me!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Pia Mattix Davis, I am a mother of two, and in May of 2017 I became fed up with the lack of compassion and empathy shown to the needs of black children on social media.

I want to become a certified Parenting Educator to teach Positive Parent to other moms, but especially Black moms as the children in our community could especially benefit from gentle parenting in a world that is rarely gentle or empathetic to their needs.

 I need $2,000 to travel to Stamford CT to attend a 4 day training session from October 13-16, 2018

The $2,000 will cover two training sessions, Teaching Parenting the Positive Discipline Way & Positive Discipline in the Classroom.  The raised funds will cover our round-trip airfare from the airport nearest our respective homes to NYC, round trip train travel to and from Stamford, CT,  Four Nights of lodging at the Marriott Hotel, where the training will be held, and food.

If I do not reach the goal,  any money raised will be used towards attending a local training session and/ or website improvements to continue the mission to support parents in the Positive Parenting Journey

 

Our Pledge

Everyday I encounter Black Moms who understand the physical and mental dangers of spanking children.  While our Facebook group has changed lives over the last year, I know that we can become more effective with proper training and  the use of resource materials to guide uI want to move from supporting mothers, to teaching mothers how to parent without physical, psychological and verbal aggression.

I will continue to serve the members of A Nurtured Child.

Once trained I will offer free and lost cost support in our communities through workshops and community classes.

Please support as I encourage and support parents in their efforts to parent without physical, psychological and verbal aggression.

story:
Shower Trump with Constitutions

Trump's ignorance of the Constitution and the protection it affords all American citizens is unforgivable and dangerous. Khizr Khan's gesture - holding up the document on which the Republic was founded, so Trump could "read it"- was the perfect signal. It highlighted that the candidate lacked knowledge of the past, respect for the law and was no patriot. With his thin skin, we are sure that arming activists and demonstrators to wave the Constitution in the Donald's face will cause him endless anger and upset - and help generate publicity on the themes laid out above, helping capture the hungry, US-loving middle-ground.
 

  • This campaign is a collaborative effort based on an idea by Stuart Elliott, for 23 years, the New York Times' world-renowned advertising columnist. 
  • Help us buy (an initial) 1789 copies of the US Constitution. We will then deluge him with them, keeping up the gesture of the "brandishing" outside Trump Tower and other properties, at rallies, on the campaign trail...Whenever he makes a personal appearance. The Donald will go from never having read the Constitution, to being sick of it. Of course, he could admit that, though. It's the Constitution!
  • Without your support, your one buck or more, we can't buy any Constitutions. We can't wave them at Trump. We can't bring this amazing idea to fruition. Would you be happy with yourself if you didn't contribute and Trump won the Presidency by a few votes. Remember President Gore? Neither do we. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is how it will work: 

  • $1789 will pay for 1,789 Constitutions to be handed out to activists and mailed out to Trump by our volunteers. We think this campaign will develop its own momentum, but transport might be extra. And, hopefully, we will soon need more Constitutions. 
  • This Campaign is not big on perks - but neither do you need to contribute much. And we think helping defeat Donald Trump is enough. 
  • Even if we don't get to the figure needed to print the bespoke Constitutions, we will still buy bulk documents which can be used for the same purpose. 

The Impact

We are sure you agree this idea has poetry and strategy in bucketloads. But this and other ideas are vitally important

  • Seldom, if ever, in the history of the country has so much been at stake at the voting booth. Yet there is a good chance, due to Donald Trump's mastery of publicity, he will become the next President of the United States. We feel this would be a disaster and President Trump could easily prove a menace to democracy, not just here at home, but such peace add there is around the world. 
  • Breaking through the noise - reaching his adoring fans - is proving incredibly difficult. We need fresh ideas to take the message to the people whose minds might be changed or who could be encouraged to leave their homes and vote on November 8. 
  • Trump is vulnerable in several areas - and this hits a few: his lack of patriotism, his lack of knowledge (and admitting he doesn't like reading), his lack of experience of the military and his careless disregard for the rule of law. 
  • He also has trouble controlling his temper but he will have to try, because this gesture calls to mind the majesty of the Constitution, military sacrifice and a grieving father. 
  • If he or his heavies attack or remove our peaceful volunteers, they will literally be attacking the Constitution. They will keep putting the story back in the media. They won't know how to handle it. 
  • The experienced a combined record of scores of years of fundraising, marketing, campaigning, journalism and politics behind us. 
  • We know what is possible when people come together to make a simple point - the idea is simple, affordable, powerful and true. We invite you to play your part in making it a reality.
  • We think this plan is relatively risk-free. We just need books and people to mail them an wave them. A healthy number of Constitutions will help generate excitement. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you don't want to or can't contribute get the word out and let your friends know about this entertaining - but deadly serious campaign.
  • There are a host of Indiegogo share tools you can use to inform colleagues, pals and family via Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

We feel this would be a disaster and President Trump could easily prove a menace to democracy, not just here at home, but such peace add there is around the world. 
Breaking through the noise - reaching his adoring fans - is proving incredibly difficult. We need fresh ideas to take the message to the people whose minds might be changed or who could be encouraged to leave their homes and vote on November 8. 
Trump is vulnerable in several areas - and this hits a few: his lack of patriotism, his lack of knowledge (and admitting he doesn't like reading), his lack of experience of the military and his careless disregard for the rule of law. 
He also has trouble controlling his temper but he will have to try, because this gesture calls to mind the majesty of the Constitution, military sacrifice and a grieving father. 
If he or his heavies attack or remove our peaceful volunteers, they will literally be attacking the Constitution. They will keep putting the story back in the media. They won't know how to handle it. 
The experienced a combined record of scores of years of fundraising, marketing, campaigning, journalism and politics behind us. 
We know what is possible when people come together to make a simple point - the idea is simple, affordable, powerful and true. We invite you to play your part in making it a reality.
We think this plan is relatively risk-free. We just need books and people to mail them an wave them. A healthy number of Constitutions will help generate excitement. 

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

If you don't want to or can't contribute get the word out and let your friends know about this entertaining - but deadly serious campaign.
There are a host of Indiegogo share tools you can use to inform colleagues, pals and family via Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

story:
Give children the happy childhoods they deserve

CRY, India’s most trusted NGO, has been working towards creating happier and healthier childhoods for the last 40 years. Thanks to the support of people like you, we’ve impacted over 3 million children in India.

But we have miles to go and need your help. Out of 472 million children in India today, many are still unable to go to school, do not get proper nutrition or healthcare and are vulnerable to abuse and exploitation.

Donate to CRY and give children a happy childhood they deserve. Your small contribution will make a big difference in their lives!

Thanks as you donate

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
In the spirit of the SDGs and the Agenda 2030 “Leave No One Behind” and ensuring Universal Health Coverage (UHC) the proposed project aims to reduce maternal and Tuberculosis (TB) deaths in line with national and global targets. The project targets adolescents and people with high vulnerability to TB and unwanted pregnancies in hard to reach areas with poor access to health information and services.The project provides a perfect opportunity to promote the right to health, strengthen health systems, and reduce poverty among the poorest households in Ghana. The project will also contribute to achieve Ghana’s target to reduce newborn deaths from 32/1000 to 21/1000 live births, national target to end child marriage and reduce the burden of TB and ultimately poverty among deprived households. To achieve this, a mobile health screening van is required to conduct regular outreach into difficult to reach areas to provide crucial and urgently needed Sexual and Reproductive Health Rights Services (SRHRS) and TB detection services by addressing three major barriers namely, accessibility, privacy and stigma.

Who are we?

Rural Initiatives for Self Empowerment-Ghana (RISE-Ghana), is a local Ghanaian Human Rights, Governance and Environment Non-Governmental Organization (NGO) operating in the Northern Parts of Ghana, West Africa with its Head Quarter in Bolgatanga in the Upper East Region. Over the past 10 years we have successfully implemented donor funded projects with huge impacts such as saving 22 girls from child and forced marriage, reducing TB deaths, promoting breastfeeding and maternal health and saving over 1,000 newborns.

Current situation and challenges:

Every year, 21 million girls aged 15-19 years get pregnant and 90% within child marriage (GirlsNotBrides 2018). Focusing on the Upper East Region, child marriage prevalance is 50% (UNICEF 2011). 50,000 girls die from pregnancy/childbirth, 95% of the deaths occur in developing countries like Ghana (GirlsNotBrides 2018). One reason for this situation can be seen in the lack of urgently needed SRHRS, particularly for those who are out of school and living in rural and remote locations.

--> Community discussion about Tuberculosis in the Upper East Region, Ghana

Another big issue for rural deprived communities is TB. In Ghana 14,550 cases of TB are registered and the estimated number of unrecorded cases are even higher (WHO 2017). In the first half of the 2018 331 new Tuberculosis cases are detected in the Upper East Region but the expected number targeted 1209 (Health Service 2018). So there is a gap of 878 undetected cases. Each of these cases could infect 10 to 15 people per year, therefore, it is important to have a mobile screening van to find these persons to avoid the projected increase of 15,717 new infections per annum. Stigma and sometimes the unwillingness of people who show TB symptoms to go for tests are major challenges. In turn, late detection of TB cases results in more complicated treatment procedures and can even lead to death of the patients involved (Upper East Regional Coordinator for TB and HIV 2013). 8 out of 15 districts in the Upper East Region indicate a loss-to follow up rate over 4% which means that the affected people in this districts don’t get the needed treatment (Ghana Health Service 2018).

Evidence from the WHO indicates that there are still far too many people failing to access quality, basic health services without risk of financial hardship. One third of people in Africa are forced to borrow money or sell assets to pay for health care. 20% of people are pushed further into poverty by paying for health care, that is they choose between buying medicine and buying food for the family (WHO 2015).

The mobile screening van is important because most of the deprived communities do not have health facilities. In addition, what it makes even more difficult is the missing ambulance system in Ghana. Especially, in the raining season the communities are not easily reachable because of the heavy rain and the bad road infrastructure. Regardless of urban health facilities, we would be able to take care of the health service in different communities, also in emergency situations and before the heavy rain is impeding the way to the patients. Furthermore, we can minimize the stigmatization of the affected persons by delivering individual support and make sure that they get the needed treatment.

 

Accountability is an important principle for our work. So we decided, in case we can not meet our target, we will spend the collected money for the same issue regarding educational work and awareness raising.

Together, let's make a difference, is possible - one life at time.

 

We thank all of you for your support!

Gerne stehen wir Ihnen auch für Fragen in deutscher Sprache zur Verfügung: riseghanango@gmail.com

story:
Why we need a free speech domain name registrar

The internet is the most powerful communications tool ever created. Control over the internet is becoming more and more monopolized. Those monopolies are using their power to censor and control speech. We must fight back now before it is too late.

Not being allowed to post on a social network can be inconvenient. Messages being deleted from an app is frustrating. A webhost deciding to remove your website for breaking their terms of service is distressing. But, a domain name registrar stealing your legally registered domain name—because they feel like it—is so offensive that corrective actions must be taken immediately.

That is why we need a free speech domain name registrar. The very foundation of the internet is being used to censor free speech. That can not be allowed to continue. Donate now and we will fight this.

What the funding will be used for

ICANN requires a registrar applicant to demonstrate they have enough working capital to adequately run a domain name registrar business. ICANN puts this amount at $70,000. ICANN also requires a $3,500 non-refundable application fee. ICANN additionally has annual fees that can amount to more than $10,000 per year.

Furthermore, the actual business of running a domain name registrar needs to be done. Servers, software, and staff; the more funding we have the better all of those can be.

If the full goal is not met, that doesn’t mean we give up. ICANN has policies for demonstrating financial adequacy for those with less than $70,000. The $3,500 application fee and annual fees are the lowest barriers we really need to clear. Even if ICANN throws up a few roadblocks we will continue to prep the servers, software, and staff so we can launch as soon as those roadblocks are cleared.

How the process will be open & transparent

Domain name registration is a vital part of the internet infrastructure. Yet, there is a lack of information on how all of it works exactly. We plan to be as open and transparent as possible.

We will strive to use only libre/open-source software, and we will document how it can be used to create a domain name registrar business. This will allow others to follow in our footsteps. The only thing better than a single free speech domain name registrar is many free speech domain name registrars.

With your help, we will build a better foundation for the open internet. Donate what you can. Speak out online, and tell others about this campaign.

story:
Samer is a polite 11 year old boy attending al Yarmouk Primary school in Gaza city. He is one of over 2,200 students at this school. He lost his father in the 2014 offensive. It is 12:30 and Samer is looking tired. Samer used to be an academic acheiver but for two years now, his grades have been dropping. He complains of muscle aches and constant, debilitating headaches which have resulted in his lack of concentration at school. Samer, like many other children in Gaza suffers from dehydration. With lack of clean drinkable water at home as well, their families often rely on drinking water bought from private vendors at a high price. The least we can do is provide clean water at school to ease this situation for Samer and his friends. Water is life and clean water means health.

Colours of Hope is a registered non-profit aid organisation. We work on a variety of projects with reliable, trustworthy organisations in ensuring delivery to worthy recipients. It is our mission to make life a little better for those in need by doing the best we can, turning hope into reality. Mahatma Gandhi said “Gentleness, self-sacrifice and generosity are the exclusive possession of no one race or religion”. We want to make a difference to as many people around the world as we can. Help us facilitate a borehole at al Yarmouk primary school together with our partners at Save Gaza Project on the ground in Gaza. We cannot do this without YOUR help.

Two-thirds of people in Gaza drink water that has been contaminated. Children drink more water per kilogram of body weight, resulting in greater exposure to contaminants. Their growing bodies areas risk as toxic chemicals cause more harm to developing organs and tissues. Contaminated water is responsible for 26% of all disease in Gaza and 50% of Gaza’s children suffer from water-related parasitic infections. These exposures can have serious effects on the health of children that continue for a lifetime.

Al Yarmouk school is situated at the centre of Gaza city, Al Thowra Street. There are two sessions per 1,100 students. The first session being from 07:00 to 13:00 and the second from 13:00 to 18:00. There are another three schools in the vicinity of al Yarmouk school that also suffers from the same water crisis as al Yarmouk school. Many taps have been removed from the walls as there is no drinkable water for the students.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES
It’s likely that demonstrable results will be possible in the first few weeks after implementation.
The project objectives are;
•To provide water for 2,300 child in Al Yarmouk school.
•To reduce the rate of infection of water-borne disease like diarrhea, blood diarrhea and typhoid by 95%.
•To ensure children get clean, reliable and sufficient water throughout the year by 100%.
•To Develop the environment of the area of the project.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION
The project will involve different activities which are not interrelated as follows;
1. Invitation of tender for the drilling of wells from different companies. The activity shall be done by the organization and the government.
2. Selection of the contractor among the tenderers who applied for the tender.
3. Survey to determine the area to drill the well. This activity will be done by the contractor in collaboration with the government.
4. The actual work of drilling the wells. The work will be done by the contractor.
5. Handing over of the project to the school administrators.

How YOU Can Help
No donation is too small. If everybody donated just a little, it would turn into a lot!

If you can't afford to donate, you can still get involved and make a difference! Please share the link to this page on your social networks and with your friends and family.

story:
Wednesday March 17th we lost a great friend and an amazing person, Dan Blonarowycz. It's very difficult to put into words how much of a impact he's had in each and every one of our lives. To me he was a mentor, a friend, a confidant, and a brother. He was a selfless person always giving and helping others. With all of this we are asking for help to give Dan a proper send off, give everyone a chance to say their goodbyes and celebrate his life with the people he loved so much. He will truly be missed. I know these are hard times so whatever you can spare will go miles and all of us really do apricate everything. Thank you all for the time and support, we love you all! 

-Phill

story:
THE HUMANITARIAN PROBLEM

Over the last days, thousands of Syrian refugees are entering Serbia and the Balkans in search of safety. We want to help these people — and especially mothers — who are carrying children to safety in their own arms. Babies may be small, but their extra weight adds up quickly without proper support. They're also carrying their supplies, including food and water, as they move. Imagine how much you'd appreciate an extra hand!

Once they leave Serbia, mothers have to walk hundreds of kilometers with babies and toddlers in their arms; a task that is physically strenuous to say the least! Serbia is only the beginning of a long and ardous trip for Syrian refugees, so we want to make sure their lives are a bit easier with baby carriers that will lessen the weight and free their arms! Baby carriers will not only keep children safely tucked against their parent's torso or back, but will also make an immediate and meaningful impact in the lives of these mothers and fathers who are in need.

This campaign is set up to collect funds so we can purchase 100 baby and toddler sized baby carriers at wholesale price and personally deliver them to Serbia. All proceeds will be spent directly in the purchase and delivery of the baby carriers. We will deliver baby carriers to refugees throughout Serbia in collaboration with our partners.

WHAT WE NEED

1 Baby carrier cost: 26 $

We are friends (from Serbia and Croatia) who are traveling to Presevo (Serbian-Macedonian border) from Belgrade on 24th of October.

WAYS YOU CAN HELP

MAKE A MONETARY CONTRIBUTION TO OUR INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN:

A $26 donation will cover the full cost of a brand new baby or toddler carrier and the cost to get it there! Every dollar helps!

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN ON FACEBOOK:

Please share so we can get ourselves known!!!

RISKS

There is literally no risk. We are going to turn your money into supplies. Excess Money will be donated!

We are going to cover percentage IndieGoGo takes, that way, 100% of your money goes to the refugees. We will also try to contact other organisations, to cooperate with.

TEAM

Our team consists of Juila and Stanislav from Serbia and Sarah and Branko from Croatia.

Contact: julia.smith.office@gmail.com

News:

https://news.vice.com/article/refugee-crisis-pits-neighbors-against-each-other-in-serbia

http://www.telegraf.rs/english/1744994-presevo-diplomats-visit-refugees

story:
Short Summary

  • Quick License was founded by Josh and co-founder Ben when they saw the problem of always carrying around, your physical drivers license. Quick License is an app in the process of developing, for you to have your ID digitally in your phone.
  • There should be solutions to these everyday problems, which is exactly what we are trying  solve, to make life easier for you and me.
  • We understand that everyone has busy lives and we want to make it more efficient by being able to have easy access to your license.
  • We all know that feeling in the morning worrying that you will forget something, well with Quick License it is one these think to forget.
  • Quick License is import not only for you to have your license digitally but also because of our advanced security technology that keeps your license safe. 
  • If Quick License seems great already its gets even better. In addition to our easy to access license scan, your license will be directly connected with the dmv to insure your security.
  • The best part about Quick License is that we are one of the first in this revolutionary digital ID industry!
  • The contributions will help us launch Quick License and get it on the app store and provide crucial funds to market and expand Quick License to the American people. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need funding for building our innovative app and marketing it to the public. Our goal is to raise 25,000 dollars in total funding with your support! 
  • Our unique perks that we will be offering to contributors only, is our first version of the app, to sign up, and get it before the entire public. 
  • If we do not reach our funding goal the money will go specifically to app design.

The Impact

  • The contribution that you make will go directly into early stage development of Quick License which is specifically targeting an untapped industry of the digital drivers license.
  • Both Josh Gershon and Ben Helman were born entrepreneurs and started their first business at the age of 9 and 10. Josh would sell snacks at school for a small profit, while Ben would sell shoes online at a young age.  
  • Both Ben and Josh are willing to give up anything to make Quick License a successful company that makes an impact on technology forever.

Risks & Challenges

One small risk that we have is the amount of states that have digital license's are small at the movement but in recent years there has been a lot of traction for digital licenses with trials already in Colorado, Maryland, Idaho, Louisiana, and the district of Colombia.

  • Josh is extremely determined and never gives up. Ben is always looking for a new way to solve problems.
  • These challenges will be solved with perseverance and hard work.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can support the Quick License movement by sharing with friends and family about our great new app and technology.

You can also email us at Quick.License.App@gmail.com for any further questions.

story:
The Discrimination Against Women: Epic Fail


My name is Shane Willow Mittman and I'm the founder of Women Endorsed. Like so many of you, I'm a woman who's tired of the ongoing fight for women's equality. Enough, already! The discrimination against women in our society and around the world is an epic failure and we’re the ones who are going to have to turn it around by any and all means we have. With your contribution, Women Endorsed directs our spending superpower for our benefit and tips the scale into balance once and for all!

Women Endorsed is a movement to harness women’s purchasing power by certifying women-positive companies. It's a certification process that’s just like the ‘Fair Trade’ movement. What this means is Women Endorsed will only qualify, verify and certify businesses that actually support women’s equality with their policies, practices and culture. This certification process empowers women to know where to spend our money!

One of the most exciting things for me about Women Endorsed is that we don’t need anyone but ourselves to make it happen! We don’t need to convince anyone of anything. We don’t need to change laws or wait for elections to come around. Women Endorsed uses what we already have and directs it for our benefit right now!

  • How’s it going to feel to never spend another penny with companies that are not good to women?

  • How’s it going to feel to put your dollars into companies that treat their employees and customers right?

  • How will it feel to tip that scale into balance once and for all by doing something you already do?

Our launch funding campaign will support three important initiatives:

  • First, WE will create WE's international business structure and a business development/investor development strategy to ensure WE's sustainability post-launch. 
     
  • Second, WE will consult and convene experts to help guide our selection of criteria and standards, and develop the process WE will use to certify companies. Our certification criteria and process are crucial to the success of WE. WE need to maintain a high standard for what we expect from companies to achieve the tangible, measurable social change that women require and expect. We also need to understand how companies record the data that WE will use to verify their practices and to provide secure ways for them to share that sensitive information safely and economically with WE.
     
  • Third, WE will develop our interactive website that supports our outward-facing engagement with women around the world and the businesses that WE certifies and supports. Our website will be a hub of information gathering and sharing. Women will need access to lists of WE-certified companies in varied industries to know where to spend our money. The site will be our community link to engage with to stay informed. Qualified, certified WE companies will expect to be celebrated and promoted to our WE community via our website as well as through the press and social media. Companies interested in becoming certified will need a welcoming, interactive, easy-to-use application process with secure, safe transmission of the private and highly sensitive documentation of their practices for verification. 

Included in our outward facing presence is our launch-stage marketing and branding. This includes logo refinement, press releases and media relations, marketing and social media activity.

The support of women (and men) for Women Endorsed is crucial. Becoming members of our private Facebook group (women-only for now), subscribing to WE’s updates at womenendorsed.com and donating to this launch campaign claims the power that belongs to us and engages our personal and collective intent to use it! 

Our cumulative, collective spending IS our superpower. It is OUR collective endorsement of businesses (and rejecting of others that are not nice to women) that IS our voice. It's critical for women to engage their support of WE to fully fund this initial launch campaign. Women Endorsed will only harness this potential as planned if WE raise the target sum required for launch. If we do not reach the target, any and all funds donated will be returned to each donor. 

WE: Gaining Momentum!

  • WE is being recognized by women around the world. Five days after our private FB group was started, 2,000 women had already joined! Now we have over 3,500 from more than 12 countries including Brazil, Croatia, Mexico, Canada, France, New Zealand, Australia, Japan, Belgium, United Kingdom and Quatar! 
  • WE has built relationships with women’s advocates who support our mission and clearly see WE’s potential to effect significant social change. 
  • WE attracted a lot of attention and support at the San Francisco Women’s March.  
     

Challenges

WE faces three important challenges:

  • First, WE's power base comes from the number of women who join the movement. Building our power base is critical to the success of WE. 
     
  • Second, and linked to the size of WE's membership, WE must create value for businesses that qualify to be Women Endorsed. The bigger WE’s membership and reach is, the more we add to the bottom line and brand value of businesses we support. Conversely, businesses that don’t support women will experience loss of loyalty, revenue and brand support from women who will not abide by the status quo in the market and workplace. 
     
  • Third, our criteria need to be strong enough recognize companies that truly support women and not so lax that we sell ourselves short.  Cumulatively, WE certification will create the significant social change women demand. 

WE will meet these challenges. WE will use your funding dollars to engage and convene high level consultants to select appropriate criteria to support our goals for the long term. WE has created an Ambassador program to grow our member power base and engage women who want to take action and be involved. WE will work with small and large women's groups, businesses and organizations to spread the Women Endorsed word, far and wide. WE will use social media, the press and speaking engagements with women-positive events to grow our base. WE will create critical mass to make this movement useful and strategic for women and critical mass to render it vital to Women Endorsed certified businesses. WE will begin by recognizing and certifying women-positive companies that already support women's equality by their policies, practices and cultures. There are many out there.
 

3 Ways You Can Help

Isn't it great to know there is action women and men can take immediately to tip the scale in support of the women's movement? Using Indiegogo's handy social media tools, you can: 

  1. Join our private Facebook group and invite all of your women friends to join in too! (Women-only for now.)
  2. Share this video with people you know and encourage them to support WE.
  3. Donate to Women Endorsed right here, right now!

story:
Two Questions for You:

Do you see a need to remedy racial bias in sentencing?

Do you see legislation to that effect happening anytime soon?

 

For all the improvements in recent years, racial bias continues to plague sentencing. With the Sentencing Reform and Corrections Act dying in Congress last year, died, too, our best shot at a comprehensive reform anytime soon.

 

 

The Plan: Turning Racial Bias Inside Out

The core idea is to regard racial bias as a flaw in judicial self-consistency.

What follows is that minimizing self-inconsistency also minimizes racial bias. Solving a more general problem is akin to the surgical incision of racial bias out of a system with tissue of inconsistency surrounding it.

“A self-consistent judge is an unbiased judge”

The ultimate goal of the project is to set up a public monitoring website where judges would be evaluated continuously and automatically based on their self-consistency.

 

Merits / Opportunities

Demanding judges to be self-consistent doesn’t affect their freedoms to cultivate their own patterns of sentencing. Case in point, a judge could be a lot more punitive than others and still rank better on self-consistency (and thus on racial fairness).

A neutral and non-emotional framing like this one has the capacity of winning the support of judges rather than antagonizing them.

Judges are the ultimate decision-makers in sentencing on a criminal case no matter how complex the system that comes before them. Because of that, any solution that revolves around a judge is future-proof in the sense that, regardless of how the criminal justice system evolves in the future, it will be able to compensate for the plethora of biases that the criminal justice system as a whole suffers from.

An exciting new direction is using FairDiscretion along with criminal justice’s emerging star, Risk-based sentencing (aka. Evidence-based sentencing). What happens in such systems is that a risk score is computed for each defendant so that it reflected the likelihood of them reoffending and then recommends a sentence according to that score. Although many profound questions and controversies linger around the concept as it is currently being used, the “big-data toolset” it makes use of could very well be used to the benefit of racial justice. In the future, through means of machine-learning, FairDiscretion could even help tailor the parameters of risk-assessment systems so that they arrive at sentences that are fair and racially unbiased.
 

Challenges

Because judges get their inputs from a system that already suffers from bias at every one of its stages (e.g. law enforcement and prosecution), some of them receive more disparate inputs than do others. We ought to account for other sources of bias to make sure that every judge is on an equal footing.

Only around 5% to 10% of cases are resolved through trials, the rest is plea bargained. Thus it is imperative that, at some point, we go beyond the judiciary and include other actors (certainly prosecutors) who have the power to exercise discretion in the process.

A careless implementation could make it possible for a judge to maintain a good overall score of self-consistency wherein a poor performance in racial fairness is being offset by good performances in all the other components of self-consistency. We need to pay extra care when implementing the system so that pockets of bias cannot linger. A solution to this could involve considering the department with the poorest performance.

 

Ways You Can Help

Contribute to the Campaign

Your support will enable us to flesh out the concept and work out the nuts-and-bolts of the system. With that, we'll be able to try out and see where this approach can take us.

Help Spread the Word

Not everybody has money to contribute. Still, you could help a great deal by sharing this page (bonus points if you use Indiegogo’s sharing tools) via social media.

Also, a personal email to friends and colleagues can go a really long way in helping us get the word out. Being from overseas makes your support all the more valuable.

Thank you so much!

Subscribe and Keep Track of Where We’re Headed

We strive to keep communication at the essentials. We don’t like churn either.

Offer Feedback

I am excited to read and consider your ideas and thoughts anytime. Feel free to email me.

 

Where Does Your Money Go?

Your contribution will enable me to dedicate the time and effort to

  • Seek out Collaborators,
  • Flesh out the concept in detail,
  • Gather access to real sentencing data,
  • Crunch the numbers and find the best possible metric for self-consistency,
  • Start building the monitoring website based on the metric we’ll have found.

 

Bio

My name is Jack Herrorwitz, and I am a writer/social entrepreneur from Budapest, Hungary with a keen interest in innovation and governance.

It was in 2012 when, out of escapism from local news, I started to follow U.S. politics closely. Bad timing. It was just around the time when police shootings of unarmed black people became a permanent fixture in the evening news.

As the stories gradually segued into a discussion about race and criminal justice, it soon dawned on me that if merely reading the news were this hard-hitting for a white person an entire ocean away, how I hadn’t the faintest idea what it must be like for a black person actually living the experience.

Reading up on articles on criminal justice, my misgivings gradually gave way to a mindset of activism out of which the idea of FairDiscretion started to emerge.

 

Looking for Colleagues

Still alone at this point, I will also be able to afford the time and effort to seek out Collaborators. Speaking of which ...

Are you a

  • Criminal justice expert

  • Data analyst

  • Web developer

intrigued by the idea?

Do you know someone who might be?

 

Find Out a Lot More at FairDiscretion.org
